ReviewTitle: Zero interest in protecting their possibly bleeding workers
ReviewText: Excellent quality in about 1/3 items. Another 1/3 ok and 1/3 unusable (defective, broken or misdescribed) which is manageable due to low prices, free returns and helpful live chat. Temu are used by many sellers for warehouse clearance of second-quality stock so Temu should update their business model to include an option to buy seconds cheaper, rather than pretending that everything is the same high quality. However they deserve 1 star or less for ignoring my report of an item with apparent spots of blood around the lid (shining under UV light). Customer service opened a ticket a week ago but have since sent only repeated auto-type replies ("If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact us") whilst totally ignoring all my questions about the possible worker bleeding whilst making items for them. They have a public ethical policy although it may not be operating at all since my email to the reporting address it gives was picked up by a US after-sales bot 'we are unable to access your account information from the country/region you are currently contacting us from'. Temu show zero capability for handling a serious worker safety report so I assume zero interest in worker safety and zero action being taken to investigate the factory or protect their possibly bleeding workers. Edit after temu's reply (below). Temu focus on the product, which was of course not the problem (they already kindly refunded). Totally looking the other way when there is blood on items probably means it's not just a matter of a worker forgetting their gloves one day. It may mean their ethical policy is unimplemented, temu is investigating nothing and the temu should themselves be rigorously investigated to establish the extent of any temu supplier workforce mistreatment.Edit after trustpilot contacted me for purchase order and telephone info to respond to temu's apparent request for my review to be removed as non-genuine. Temu know it's genuine as I've been discussing the issue with them daily since may 25th on a customer service ticket in my name.Edit after temu closed my customer service ticket with no acknowledgement or solution for anything I raised. 15 auto-responses in reply to my 12 detailed respectful questions. They invited a review of their service, I wrote...Uncaring and bad business. Shameful.Closed the ticket without any meaningful response on any of the 5 issues raised. Temu should be able to discuss all 5 but attempted zero. The irony is that all the issues are good for temu to solve, but bad for business and reputation to ignore. So why ignore?!

ReviewTitle: Temu Support lied and refused to help
ReviewText: There were issues with delivery of a chair I paid for. I waited a month, it came to my country and finally Temu refused to deliver it to my city. I needed it for my upcoming trip in a few days, so it ruined my experience. Their support said it will be delivered and to contact the courier, then another support agent said it won't be delivered.They offered 20% discount up to 39 BGN on all orders. After making a small order just to test it, I got a 9 BGN discount. I wanted to use the rest 30 BGN discount that was promised but Temu support refused that. I spent literally over 3 hours chatting with them, they were very unprofessional and sent only copy-paste generic responses. I insisted to escalate it to a manager and they made a ticket which was closed within 1 min. with the same copy-paste response from a 'senior' who obviously hadn't even read my message. Then I insisted to make another ticket 1748375493032845, but got the same copy-paste messages, with the exception that this time they make me wait a day to get each of their copy-paste responses that don't help at all.All in all, Temu's customer support has degraded dramatically in the recent months. They've just wasted my time with false promises and ruined my trip. I've ordered over 200 items from Temu in the last 2 years but if this doesn't get solved, this will be my last order with them. And judging from the same copy-paste responses they write on reviews here, it's unlikely that anybody from Temu's support would care to help me and resolve this...

ReviewTitle: I can't speak to the quality of Temu's‚Ä¶
ReviewText: I can't speak to the quality of Temu's products, but their shipping process is very disappointing. In Canada, they use a delivery service called PDN Express, which has numerous negative reviews and a reputation for questionable practices. In my case, they falsely marked my package as delivered when it never arrived. It's frustrating that Temu continues to partner with such an unreliable carrier. Once the sale is complete, it seems like customer support and accountability are no longer a priority. I expected better oversight from a major retailer.

ReviewTitle: Even 1 star is too much!!
ReviewText: Even 1 star is too much!!! Absolutely outrageous service ‚Äî 3 hours wasted, then she disappeared.I spent over 3 hours in the Timu customer service chat today trying to solve a very simple issue.I placed ONE order, which Timu decided to split into THREE separate packages. Now I want to return some items, but the website only allows one free return and only shows two of the three packages ‚Äî so I cannot combine everything into a single return. That means I‚Äôd have to pay out of pocket to ship part of my return back to China, which can cost ‚Ç¨80+. I refuse to do that.I explained the situation calmly, clearly, and repeatedly. I even sent screenshots and detailed messages (written with help from ChatGPT to avoid confusion). I broke it down into small parts to make it easier for the agent to understand. But she didn‚Äôt answer a single one of my questions. Not one.All she did in 3 hours was refund me for one broken cat fountain. That‚Äôs it.Then, after 3 hours of chat, and without warning, she suddenly asked, ‚ÄúAre you still there?‚ÄùYes, I was ‚Äî I had just gone to the bathroom for 3 minutes. When I came back, she was gone. No goodbye. No warning. No solution.And I‚Äôm left with a large return I can‚Äôt process and a situation she never resolved. I feel like I‚Äôm living in a twilight zone. It‚Äôs surreal. How can you be in customer service and just vanish after 3 hours of ignoring someone?This is not customer service. This is a broken, robotic, scripted system that wastes your time and leaves you worse off than when you started.Timu: you wasted my entire Sunday evening.This experience was outrageous.And, she ignored ALL my very clear structured messages......and offered in those 3 hours not 1 solution. So now I'm stuck. I need to return it, the website doesn't allow it and I'm not paying for the items I want to return and certainly not paying for any shipping cost of the return package. ------------Update in response to Timu‚Äôs reply:You asked for additional information, and I‚Äôve filled in what I can ‚Äî but please note: your system only allows one order number, while this issue involves three separate packages from a single order.The core issue remains unresolved:I spent over three hours in chat with your customer service explaining this problem in detail ‚Äî that your website only allows one free return and doesn‚Äôt let me combine items from all three packages. I cannot return everything without paying high shipping costs, and I was offered no solution.Yes, I was refunded for a broken cat fountain ‚Äî but that wasn‚Äôt the main issue. The refund was delayed because your team kept asking multiple times how I wanted to receive it, even though I clearly said twice: via the original payment method.After all that, I was told the ‚Äúproblem was solved‚Äù ‚Äî because I don‚Äôt need to return the broken item. But the actual problem ‚Äî the return of multiple packages ‚Äî was never addressed. I‚Äôm still stuck.I honestly wonder if your support staff even read the structured messages I sent ‚Äî because I repeated myself clearly and calmly for hours. And still: no answers. Just delays, copy-paste replies, and more confusion.You wasted my Sunday evening, and now you‚Äôre wasting my time again. Please escalate this to someone who can offer an actual solution. I have a surgery this week and cannot keep repeating myself endlessly.----------Update for TEMU to your reply: Update:Thanks for your reply, but I‚Äôve already explained my situation multiple times and never received real support. This message is clearly automated and doesn't acknowledge the actual issue. If you truly care about customer satisfaction, read what I wrote and respond accordingly.-------------------Review:Today is June 2nd. I went back into the Temu chatroom again to try and resolve an issue with a simple return.Once again, they ignored everything I said, repeated prefab answers, and told me to ‚Äúwait 24 hours‚Äù for the higher department to respond. I told them, repeatedly, that I am having back surgery in 24 hours, and will not be able to contact them, coz I'm in the OR and return the package afterward because I won‚Äôt be able to walk.She kept ignoring thisI explained it calmly, then clearly, then urgently. They just kept saying, ‚Äúwe understand, but you have to wait.‚Äù Wait for what? For your mistake to become my burden?I offered to donate the pillow I can‚Äôt return. I uploaded screenshots. I solved most of it myself, without their help. And still, no resolution‚Äîonly robotic replies and zero accountability.Temu, your customer service is a disaster. It doesn‚Äôt listen. It doesn‚Äôt act. It doesn‚Äôt care.And Giovanna R. is by far the most unhelpful, inattentive customer agent I‚Äôve dealt with. But so are the others I had to deal with. Yesterday and today.Case closed.I‚Äôm sending the returns tomorrow, without their so-called help.

ReviewTitle: Temu is like a treasure hit and miss
ReviewText: Temu is like a treasure cave, sometimes you get stuff of good quality but most of the time you just get stuff that you can't even use or not what you thought you ordered. They rarely give details about the item and or accurate specifications. They advertise things like real leather, real this or that, but most of the time is not even real, but synthetic stuff. I have had good stuff from Temu, but it is a hit and miss. Recently I bought items for my business to use as merchandise, over ¬£400 worth, and only 50% of it I would use without feeling embarrassed about it. The rest is junk. I have returned a few things for a full refund. I have now learnt not to expect a lot from Temu, and if the item is similar price elsewhere, then I will not buy from Temu, as they take forever to get the items to us and it may not even be as expected. Probably best not to use Temu for serious items but only for fun trinkets.

ReviewTitle: Temu is OK you get what you pay for
ReviewText: Temu is OK you get what you pay for. It used to be better but of late I have noticed the following. BE WARNED if you place an item in your cart the price will change and go up. ReviewTitle: Buyer Beware
ReviewText: I purchased two night tables which were advertised as "local." I paid for them but when I received confirmation of the sale, there was $72 in import duties charged. I complained, and indicated that I would be returning them. I was instructed to arrange for the shipping, pay for it, and I would be reimbursed, but they only reimbursed me for the cost of the items, not the duty and not the shipping charges. it took several weeks to get the refund and I am now arguing with them over the shipping charges and the duty. They now say that I will not receive a refund on the duty because it was not their fault nor was it the fault of the manufacturer. However, it was advertised as ‚ÄúLocal‚Äù which to me means it‚Äôs in my country or my city and therefore I should not have had to pay duty. It‚Äôs actually kind of interesting because when I was initiating the complaint, their agents agreed that it said local but still denied that they were responsible. I think they just try to out-wait you and hope you‚Äôll go away.There is an update to the above. Perhaps due to my persistence, TEMU has now processed a credit equal to the return shipping charges, but still take no responsibility for the fact the the item was described as "Local" yet was actually shipped from the US which resulted in import charges. I will likely use up this credit but after that is gone, do not think I will deal with them again because they are not particularly good at taking responsibility for their own errors.My best advice is not to buy anything too expensive from them so you won't experience what I went through.

ReviewTitle: Will Not Be Ordering Again from Temu in a Hurry - Order ID: PO-012-[REDACTED NUMBER HERE]
ReviewText: i ordered a 4TB USB HDD from temu (Order ID: PO-012-[REDACTED NUMBER HERE]). this item was intended as a gift.today the temu package arrived and it was not the item that i had ordered and paid for. instead of the 4 TB HDD i had ordered, i received an SSD device - a completely different item, and not what i wanted.so now i have an item that i cannot use as the gift i had intended.i go online and request a refund using temu's 'request a refund' (non-human) process. i complete all the online prompts and reach the 'print return label' section.this does not bode well.i do not have a printer, and i am certainly not interested in purchasing one just to print a return label for an item that was mistakenly posted to me. furthermore, having increasingly problematic chronic groin pain (as a result of 3 bilateral groin surgeries), i have enough trouble going to the WC, let alone outside of my residence.there is no facility online to request that temu or the seller send me a return label by post, which i can then attach to the item and then have the postal worker that delivers my mail to my residence take the package for a return.temu's online links take me to an automated chat system that instructs me to go to a post office or library etc. to print the label. this is not an option for me or generally for people with disabilities or impairments of one kind or another.the seller sent me the wrong item - it is their responsibility, not the buyers' to jump through hoops.in fact, the buyer, in addition to receiving an immediate refund, should be compensated for having their time and effort wasted due to seller-instigated errors.i will be issuing a charge-back request if i do not receive an immediate refund, and i will not be inclined to purchase any further items from temu. this is my second purchase from temu, and we already have a 50% strike (or error) rate - not good.if temu read this, please don't bother asking me to go online (again), or use the temu app. - i have already been online searching for help to no avail - and i will not be wasting any more of my time.very disappointed.------------------------------------AN UPDATE - JUNE 2, 2025------------------------------------after writing the aforementioned review a few days ago i received an e-mail from TRUSTPILOT asking me to click a link in the same e-mail as TEMU apparently wanted a little more information regarding my TRUSTPILOT review above.i clicked the link and was taken to a page asking me for my full name, temu order number/ID, and my telephone number.i completed the online form.today (june 2, 2025) i received an e-mail from my payment processor indicating that a full refund of my temu purchase has been issued, and an e-mail from TEMU HELP (help [AT] service.temu.com) apologizing for the events following my purchase.---------------------------------MY TAKE-HOME MESSAGE:---------------------------------if you have a genuine grievance, take the time to go online and create a TRUSTPILOT (or other review site) review.even if your complaint is not resolved to your satisfaction, other (potential) buyers may find your experience(s) useful.best wishes.oh, i have redacted my temu Order ID that i provided in my original review above just to be safe.have a good day.

ReviewTitle: Temu Ignores EU Law ‚Äì Escalated to ECC Cyprus
ReviewText: [UPDATE ‚Äì June 27, 2025] ‚Äì Store credit granted, but only after EU intervention.The case has now been officially filed with the Small Claims Court, in addition to the ongoing investigation by ECC Cyprus and the Irish CCPC.This step was necessary due to Temu‚Äôs ongoing refusal to comply with EU Directive 2011/83 ‚Äì Article 16, regarding store credit for non-returnable cosmetic items.üìå After 74 days, and only after the ECC escalated the matter, Temu finally issued a ‚Ç¨24.16 store credit. No apology. No acknowledgment of wrongdoing. Just silence ‚Äî once they knew the ECC was involved.All documentation has been submitted to both the ECC and the District Court. The case remains registered and pending before a judicial authority.üì¢ I‚Äôve publicly documented the full process: üëâ @Filippos1438411‚ö†Ô∏è If you‚Äôre an EU customer: don‚Äôt rely on luck or ‚Äúcustomer service.‚Äù You may need to involve official bodies to get what you're entitled to by law.‚úÖ I promised I wouldn‚Äôt give up ‚Äî and I didn‚Äôt. Not until the law was respected. No bots, no excuses.Update (May 30, 2025):Thank you for your generic response. However, my complaint concerns a legal matter under EU Directive 2011/83/EE and has already been escalated to the European Consumer Centre (ECC) Cyprus.I urge Temu to stop sending automated replies and instead escalate this case to a supervisor or legal department.Customer satisfaction cannot be achieved if you disregard EU consumer rights.This matter is not about a refund alone ‚Äî it‚Äôs about respecting EU law and consumer protection.

ReviewTitle: By now I must have placed around 15‚Ä¶
ReviewText: By now I must have placed around 15 orders. The prices, the selections, the website is very user-friendly, the quality of the items, and the notifications have been outstanding My only recommendation is to work with a tape measure, do not rely on the pictures, almost all of the pictures shown are not reliable, the items look much bigger, however in the details, the sizes have been accurate.Temu made it possible on endless occasions to do projects that we couldn't have done otherwise. This is all 5 star.The not so good, is customer support when you need help, in our case having received many coupons we kept placing orders but Temu kept cancelling them, 12 orders that cancelled over 2-3 weeks of time, This was very aggravating, time consuming and somewhat financially impactful (we would lose on the refunds due to exchange rate with our own bank). Customer support was very inapt, no solutions only perfunctory repeated messages. Especially with supervisor Zet, for that I would give 1 star.

ReviewTitle: Deceptive Promotion and Refusal to Honor
ReviewText: I placed an order through Temu‚Äôs app with a promotion offering 3 gifts for $0.01 each. My transaction page clearly showed the gifts and said ‚ÄúCheckout for gifts.‚Äù No terms, no disclaimers, just a banner confirming the offer.After paying, the gifts never never appeared in my order. I contacted support and went through four tiers of reps, all giving me the same copy/paste excuse that I didn‚Äôt qualify, even though my receipt clearly shows I did.This is a classic bait-and-switch. Temu used a fake promo to drive a sale and refused to honor it. That‚Äôs deceptive and unethical.I‚Äôm asking Temu to make it right: send the 3 items at the promised price. If not, I‚Äôll keep sharing this experience and filing complaints. Customers deserve honesty, not tricks.

ReviewTitle: May 2025
ReviewText: Update, a reply to Temu's feedbackFirst, I dont believe for one second Temu is "sorry I'm not satisfied with some of my items. Second, not some goods, all of them! I can forward photos to you and Trustpilot if you like and you can compare to Temu's website. Take the time to look at the pictures I posted and tell me that you would find these products acceptable. Third is a lie: clearly you do not have any quality control. If you did you would not have dared sent this rubbish, and to be clear, I mean goods that look absolutely nothing like the photos on your website. In fact, I would go as far as to say that what you are doing is fraud. A couple of months ago, I bought a rug and it is satisfactory - not great but ok - this time, however, the quality of the goods $150 worth of goods is so bad, so awful i've requested refunds (I have photos!). The problem is Temu only allows one refund per delivery, and one return. Ah ha! got ya! haven't they. You might occasionally get lucky but odds are most goods on Temu are rubbish; and if you must order from them I would advise that you only order one item at a time. That way you stand a better chance of getting a refund without all the hassle of making a return - who has the time? - and of course Temu banks on that very fact. Rubbish, rubbish, rubbish. And, finally, if anyone customer is reading this, Temuballows for one refund and one return per order. So if you buy a bundle of stuff, which I'm sure a lot of people do, you can only claim a small partial refund; you lose no matter how Temu wants to 'redirects your attention.

ReviewTitle: Terrible customer service and failed delivery ‚Äì never ordering from Temu again
ReviewText: I placed an order with Temu that was supposed to be redelivered on May 24th. As of today, nothing has arrived. No one answers the phone, the delivery driver ignores repeated calls, and customer support has been utterly unhelpful.The first agent I spoke with didn‚Äôt even realize the tracking system had the wrong address. I had to ask twice before they finally checked. No wonder the package never showed up.To make matters worse, I received a call from the delivery company five days ago, asking if I spoke Thai and saying they couldn‚Äôt locate my address. Clearly, the item was already out for delivery, yet Temu completely failed to manage the situation.This order was meant as a surprise for my daughter, and Temu‚Äôs incompetence has ruined it.I‚Äôve now deleted my Temu account and will never order from them again. I‚Äôll also be sharing this experience on the Apple App Store, Google Play, and other review platforms to warn others.Final verdict: A complete waste of time, full of frustration, and a shocking lack of accountability.Update, 28.05.2025: After multiple emails, phone calls, and a completely failed redelivery, Temu only bothered to respond AFTER I posted a negative review on Trustpilot. That alone speaks volumes about how seriously they take customer service.What did I get? A token ‚Äúcompensation‚Äù of ‡∏ø70 credit (barely ‚Ç¨2) and a 20% discount coupon ‚Äî not as an apology, but clearly as a thinly veiled sales tactic.Let‚Äôs be clear:This is not compensation ‚Äî this is a manipulative push to make me place another order, even though the first package still hasn‚Äôt arrived. To make matters worse, the coupon is only valid until May 31st, essentially pressuring me to buy again within a week, or lose it. That‚Äôs not customer support ‚Äî that‚Äôs predatory marketing.And still: no package, no apology, no real solution.This entire experience has been appalling. What was meant to be a special surprise for my daughter has turned into a time-consuming mess of frustration, delays, and indifference. I‚Äôve already deleted my Temu account, and I will continue warning others on YouTube and other review platforms.If you‚Äôre thinking about ordering from Temu, ask yourself:Are you ready to be ignored, gaslighted, and handed a promo coupon instead of real help?I wasn‚Äôt ‚Äî and I won‚Äôt be coming back.

ReviewTitle: I‚Äôve had multiple frustrating‚Ä¶
ReviewText: I‚Äôve had multiple frustrating experiences with Temu‚Äôs promotions.First, I participated in a cashback event where users were supposed to log in daily to claim rewards. I did log in every day, but the app showed an error and didn‚Äôt let me claim the bonus. I contacted support, and they acknowledged the issue and promised to credit the bonuses manually. But that never happened. Later, they changed their story and claimed I had received the rewards which is completely false.And just today they offered me to add just 15‚Ç¨ instead of 45‚Ç¨, which I had to get. Second, I used Temu‚Äôs official ‚Äúprice adjustment‚Äù feature on a previous order. After that, I was silently banned from participating in promotions without any warning or explanation. This condition wasn‚Äôt mentioned in any promo terms, and support again denied responsibility.It feels like Temu blocks users from rewards as soon as they actually stand to benefit. Their support keeps changing narratives, ignoring facts, and avoiding responsibility.Very disappointing and dishonest.

ReviewTitle: Cheap trash site, but it's okay if you keep some rules.
ReviewText: Never order anything that can gets your house on fire. If you follow this golden rule, you can get some cheap stuff that is indeed alright. I ordered some canvas prints. 7 out of 10 is actually surprisingly good quality, so check the reviews under the item and if they say it's ok, it mostly true.But never order anything you plug into your power outlet.Also ordered replacement parts to our robot vac. mops, side brushes feels alright, but the trash bag were so bad, the station's suction power suck the dust through it and the whole compartment ended up full of dust. Yet this is just one bag and there is 10 or even 100 seller selling them. I guess others can be good, so it's again about luck. Except electric stuff... Never order anything that can melt in your power outlet.I also ordered guitar wall mounts, but only for my old GuitarHero and RockBand guitars to use them as decor. Not sure if i ever want to put my real one on them, but i ordered them for the playthings, so it's alright.My mother always asks for different dog collars. They also seems pretty.So all and all Temu is fine as long as you can see where the cheap and fine ends and too good to be true starts.(Never order chargers. As soon as i opened it i started to laugh and trashed it)

ReviewTitle: Temu‚Äôs new shipping scam is a trap‚Äîdon‚Äôt fall for it. I would give it zero stars if that was a choice.
ReviewText: Would give no stars if I could.Temu used to be fun. Now it‚Äôs just a trap.They‚Äôve silently changed their policies so that shipping fees apply per seller, and you only get free shipping if you spend over $30 from a single store. That means if you buy two tiny items from two shops‚Äîsay, a $0.32 keychain and a $3 clearance item‚Äîyou‚Äôll get hit with $6 in shipping fees. I had a $2.45 credit and still had to pay more than my entire cart just to check out.I tried customer service. I was passed around for nearly an hour, only to get vague apologies and a copy-paste explanation about ‚Äúdifferent warehouses.‚Äù No actual resolution. Just more stalling.Temu has turned into a fee-harvesting machine. This new model preys on casual buyers who won‚Äôt notice they‚Äôre being overcharged until checkout. It‚Äôs deceptive, it‚Äôs manipulative, and it‚Äôs intentional.I‚Äôll be deleting my account, and I strongly suggest you read the fine print before giving them your time or money. They‚Äôve gone from discount shopping to scam-tier bait-and-switch.I would also like to know that this is not the first time this has happened so this is what prompted me/this was my final straw because they‚Äôre incredibly predatory and they are a wolf in sheep‚Äôs clothing.

ReviewTitle: Why TEMU Price Adjustment Isn't a Courtesy-It's a Control Tactic
ReviewText: Have you noticed TEMU‚Äôs latest marketing tactic that seems designed to exploit customers? Here‚Äôs how it works: they initially overcharge for a product, then, after your order is placed and delivered, they offer a ‚ÄúPrice Adjustment.‚Äù But there‚Äôs a catch: the refund isn‚Äôt returned to your original payment method. Instead, it‚Äôs issued as TEMU credit, effectively locking your money into their platform.This tactic subtly pressures customers to make another purchase, with a minimum spend of $40, just to use their credit. It‚Äôs a calculated way to retain customers without addressing product quality or service standards.Rather than focusing on genuine improvements, TEMU appears to be manipulating customer retention, hiding poor reviews, and profiting from a closed-loop credit system. When you raise concerns, they claim they want to ‚Äúserve you again,‚Äù but in reality, they‚Äôve created a system that forces you to return simply to recover money they refuse to refund properly.That‚Äôs not customer service. It‚Äôs manipulation, and for those fed up with low standards, it‚Äôs coercion. Walking away means saying goodbye to your credit, money TEMU gets to keep.

ReviewTitle: Shop at Poundland Instead
ReviewText: Shopping for items and everything is a pop up, but they will deliver in 4 days! Buy the item and that changes to 9 days. Whatever. Item arrives and it's badly packaged and completely smashed (wood and glass). Instigate a return and I'm offered 10% of the cost of I keep the completely unusable item. Carry on with the return and it's the most convoluted process. I guess that's on purpose. Must include barcodes (no barcodes on item?). Must be well packaged (not returned in the original, pointless package but decent packaging at own expense). Subject to a review to ascertain whether a refund will be made. Money will be refunded in 52 days. Seriously, this site is a complete con. If I want cheap tat in the future I'll go to Poundland. It's the same quality but the returns process is actually legal.In response to the message below, I have deleted my account and won't be returning. A bit like the broken item that you made impossible to return. I'm sure your returns policy, fake discounts and constant spamming break a lot of UK and EU selling laws.

ReviewTitle: Formal Dispute and Request for Clarification Regarding Return Under Tracking #404388256269
ReviewText: Temu Customer Service,I am formally dispute the handling of my recent return associated with tracking number 404388256269, and to request a detailed explanation regarding six additional items that you claim were received under this return but allegedly belong to another account.1. All Items Were Returned TogetherI returned a total of seven (7) items in one sealed parcel, using the return label and tracking number provided by Temu. The parcel, measuring 380mm x 470mm and weighing 1.70 kg, was shipped and delivered successfully. The tracking information confirms that the parcel was received by Temu.2. Acknowledgment of Six Extra ItemsYour team has acknowledged receiving six additional items in the same parcel but claims they are associated with another account. This assertion is not only improbable but unfounded, as the parcel was sealed by me and contained only the items I originally purchased and intended to return. It is unreasonable to suggest that items from another account could have been included without explanation.3. Lack of Logical ExplanationIf these six items do not belong to me, then the following critical questions must be addressed: ‚Ä¢ Why were these items received and processed under my tracking number? ‚Ä¢ Why were they accepted into your return system without being flagged at the time of receipt? ‚Ä¢ On what basis does Temu assert that these items belong to another customer without providing supporting evidence?4. Request for EvidenceTo resolve this matter transparently, I request the following: ‚Ä¢ A complete list of the six items you claim are from another account. ‚Ä¢ Concrete evidence proving these items were not included in my original order or return. ‚Ä¢ Any internal documentation, tracking logs, or audit trails linking these six items to a different account.5. Request for Immediate RefundGiven that: ‚Ä¢ I returned all seven of my items in a single, sealed parcel using the provided return label, ‚Ä¢ The parcel was delivered and received under the specified tracking number, ‚Ä¢ There is no presented evidence of any error or wrongdoing on my part,I am formally requesting a full refund for all seven items returned. The alleged presence of additional items should not delay or invalidate my refund, particularly in the absence of clear proof that the error originated from my side.

ReviewTitle: Temu and the mysterious case of the disappearing promotion.
ReviewText: I'll be saying nothing that hasn't been said before in other reviews with regard to Temu promotions, however I believe it is important to continue to highlight the issue in the hope that Temu will eventually realise the level of customer dissatisfaction this causes and revise their practices accordingly. In essence, Temu applies money off promotions to customer accounts, and when the customer proceeds to checkout expecting the relevant discount to be deducted, the offer disappears without warning and checkout displays the full price again with no discount. This was the case again for me today (¬£7 off a ¬£7.01+ shop), and is just one of many such occurrences on my account. Customer service agents will claim that the promotions are time limited and will have expired when payment is attempted, however there is never any on screen indication of this to customers. Apart from these so called "promotions" being entirely misleading, not to mention unethical, customers can waste an inordinate amount of time choosing items to purchase to take advantage of the offer, only to be disappointed when it is inexplicably withdrawn. Interestingly, these particular promotions never seem to feature in the Expired Offers on customers' accounts, leading to suspicion that, in reality, they never actually existed in the first place and are simply a means of attempting to generate additional sales.

ReviewTitle: WARNING! Do NOT Buy from Temu!!
ReviewText: WARNING!! Do NOT buy from Temu!! This item quality is TRASH!! And now Temu is BLATANTLY committing fraud by refusing to refund my order of $103.49 for two items I returned securely via the UPS QR Code they gave me for the return. I even have the receipt to prove the return was received by UPS and both items were sent inside of the same package. Temu waited a bit of time and then sent me a note buried inside of the app saying they declined the return. They gave 2 totally different reasons: 1) because the warehouse can‚Äôt find the items, so they can‚Äôt give me a refund. OR 2) they say the package the warehouse received was empty. Which makes ZERO sense, since UPS would not accept and give me a receipt for an empty package!! I spent over ONE HOUR on chat with customer service. And all they did was keep passing me around to 3 different departments who kept writing the same pre-written excuse with the 2 different ridiculous stories (wAREHOUSE can‚Äôt find the package or the package was empty when the WAREHOUSE received it.)I pointed out to them that I should not be penalized for what happens in their warehouse after they legitimately received the package through UPS, which is a reputable source. I also pointed out that maybe their warehouse staff stole the contents of the package?! I have demanded a refund but they continue to ignore me. I have been a loyal customer for a long time, but this is inexcusable and I want to warn people to NEVER shop with them again unless you want to be ripped off.My guess is that since the packages might be sent from China, now that they have new tariffs in place ‚Äî Temu simply doesn‚Äôt want to bother to ship the returned packages back, so they want to blame the customers by claiming that the packages weren‚Äôt received or were empty?!I wish I could give Temu ZERO stars‚Ä¶but the minimum allowed was 1 star.

ReviewTitle: Problems with Temu settled!
ReviewText: Temu has been having horrible press here in the UK, TV and newspapers and me always defending them! I was even contacted by Temu to give newspaper interviews, which I did not accept, not because I didn't believe in Temu but because the bad press, that could turn against me! Glad I didn't agree to defend them!!!! They have now shown their true colours for the sake a few pounds. Before there were times when I was begging to send the items back, but no, I would just get a refund and would have to give them again, now something is faulty I am treated in this way??? NO!I ordered a few things and sent back one pair of sunglasses I didn't feel had enough quality. Took a neck cushion on holidays, seemed OK, when I got back the foam had deteriorated or something and I had neck pain, so I talked to Temu about sending it back. They wanted postage costs for the first time. I pointed out that the items was faulty! They would hear. Contacted the next day again, received a return label, no talk about postage costs. I didn't trust it so before I sent it back I insisted on knowing if I would have to pay anything, told that if the item passed inspection then I would get my money. Now saw that they deducted the postage costs, so I didn't have the opportunity to say no and give the item away. If there is no assurance they deal with problems no one should buy with this company! They are now in the UK, but they won't give me the details of where I can complain, which by law they have to! I had seen quite a lot of reviews on their website of people complaining of the same problems, but it had never happened to me, now I am a victim too. Talked to a friend who also buys from Temu regularly, she is still treated well and her concerns still heard. Something is very wrong with this company. Also the costumer service, before very polite and willing to solve problems, no more! This could have happened because I was truthful in my reviews and even if they gave my money back I would tell the truth about the item. Disgraceful! UPDATE: Temu has now given my money back! Now I have to clarify whether one has any protection in case something goes wrong within reasonable time. So, I will be back shopping with Temu, but keeping my eyes wide open, and if things go wrong again, that will be the end of the road for me, which is sad.... before I honestly loved Temu!!!

ReviewText: I have bought over 50 items from Temu and they are the future of the retail market for many smaller consumer items. Quality is almost always excellent but photos arranged to suggest bigger products than arrive, so check dimensions which are always somewhere. Packaging is often poorContinual bombarding with sales pitches are annoying and often hard to understand

ReviewTitle: Absolutely Appalling Delivery Experience via Temu/Yodel - A Full Day Wasted and Now Inconveniencing Others
ReviewText: My order from Temu, which was entrusted to Yodel for delivery, has resulted in an absolutely appalling experience. Today was supposed to be a straightforward delivery between 14:59 and 16:59. Like many, I had to rearrange my work schedule to ensure I was home during this window ‚Äì a sacrifice that has now proven to be a complete waste of my time, thanks to the poor delivery service.As I write this at 20:59, my parcel has still not arrived. Despite contacting Yodel's online chat facility (Temu's chosen courier), I was simply told to wait as the driver was supposedly in my area. This contradicted the tracking information, which clearly showed the driver moving further away from my location for the past three hours since 14:05 this afternoon. It's unacceptable that Temu would partner with a courier that provides such inaccurate information.The incompetence is staggering and reflects poorly on Temu's choice of delivery partner. Not only has Yodel, on behalf of Temu, wasted my entire afternoon and evening, but now I am forced to inconvenience a friend or family member by asking them to stay at my property tomorrow so I don't have to take another day off work. This disruption to my life is a direct consequence of the unreliable delivery service arranged by Temu.It's a stark contrast to how customers are treated. If I were to miss a payment to Temu, I'm sure consequences would follow. Yet, when their chosen courier completely disregards my time and disrupts my entire day, the expectation seems to be that I should simply accept it. This reflects poorly on Temu's customer service standards if they condone such poor delivery practices.I will update this review tomorrow to reflect how Yodel, on behalf of Temu, handles this situation and what new excuses they conjure up. As it stands, this entire delivery experience through Temu and their chosen courier has been nothing short of a complete and utter failure. Temu needs to seriously reconsider their delivery partnerships if they value customer satisfaction. Avoid ordering if you value your time and require reliable delivery.

What is my guarantee that the next package will arrive? I feel like because I've always been fair when there is an understandable delivery problem, - patient and understanding, I was taken for a fool. Nice people are not fools. We are nice by choice. I know full well I'm entitled to a refund, not just credit. I don't like having my time wasted with nonsense.

ReviewTitle: This is my 2nd order now with Temu and‚Ä¶
ReviewText: This is my 2nd order now with Temu and both times I have had damaged goods. They are damaged massively by the inappropriateness of how Temu have packed them. An orange plastic bag that has fragile items in it. How on earth are those items, packed in this way going to make it from a factory in China, going on a plane and then through a courier process ever going to be delivered in one piece! Purchased party items where light up letters are chipped and broken, a slit in the bag where 2 items must have fallen out as they aren‚Äôt included, metal drink holders massively dented so un-useable. All in my opinion, avoidable by packing in a box. 100% would have made it to me in one piece if arrived in box. The exact same thing happened on my initial order. And I can see in these comments loads of comments about damaged items. So I leave this feedback in the hope they change this going forward. In all honesty the prices are cheap and I expect to be happy with some pieces and others not so, it‚Äôs the gamble of purchasing from these low priced sites. But I don‚Äôt get packing them in a way they are never ever going to make it to you in one piece. So with the party being a week away I can‚Äôt reorder damaged / missing items and guarantee getting in time. So disappointed when it‚Äôs in Temus control. Pls reconsider how you pack orders on orders that can break.

ReviewTitle: Up to now I thought Temu was fairly‚Ä¶
ReviewText: Up to now I thought Temu was fairly safe but recently I discovered to my detriment how risky the service is, in particular to the delivery side if items to ensure receipt of goods. I had order just around ¬£150 of goods 02.05.25. The app stated to expect delivery between 12.5.35 to 16.5.25. I waited but did not receive anything. Checked neighbour nothing. Finally made an enquiry with Temu for non receipt was sent a picture showing my packages in a recycling bin for which collection was Friday. I was horrified by what i discovered. I have not used recycling for ages but my neighbours do and uses the same boxes for rubbish. My packages was left on an insecure expose place at the front of the property in the open shallow recycling rubbish box. I had not receive notification of where it was left only on the app stating it was delivered but not me. Just left on open ground. Who would want anything delivered bythis method. I would never and did not instruct my packages to be left in this manner. Its totally unsafe. This is outrageous and callous. I've advised my whole family and friends not yo use the services as it's like throwing your hard earned money away. I've told my sister to cancel her recent order as she's unlikely yo get it in such a gamble to deliver. There no point. Temu don't deserve any points for the delivery services they provide. This lack of transparency is frustrating and undermines trust in your advertising.It was evident that the chat support could neither resolve my issue nor locate the product in question.TEMU does offer some good products. However, when it comes to addressing concerns or seeking direct explanations, the chat service is usually ineffective. ReviewTitle: Payment not same as order total
ReviewText: I oder items, paid for it and immediately cancelled an item. The credit of this item as well as other credits was used in the SAME order I cancelled from, bringing the order total to R132, but the amount of R739 I paid to Payflex wasn't adjusted as well, I had to pay the full amount to them. R607 more than the actual order total. The amount I pay for Payflex they pay over to Temu for the order, so Temu received R607 more from Payflex, and I loose R607. I contact support hundred of times, they were unable to resolve my query with an acceptable outcome. They keep on nagging about the refunds/credits that was applied, but that isn't my actual query. My main concern is I loose R607 but someone won R607 who not have the right. I think they didn't confirm/authorize the correct amount to Payflex. They say it's Payflex fault, and it isn't. Payflex is also not willing to help, their support is also non-existing.

ReviewTitle: Damaged Item
ReviewText: I finally received my parcel today but im disappointed. The goods are there and nothing is missing but the package had a tear hole in it & the one item wich is a knife sharpener has chafe marks on the one side wich makes it looks second hand and used, also the packet it was in has a hole in it on the sticker and thats probably how that marks got there wich tells me that this package was just tossed around everywhere it has traveled without fragile precaution wich in my eyes is very poor service. The other goods are ok, except that there is no instructions with it about how to use the product but i guess i can just google it. All in all im not really happy with the service & the red & black knife sharpener with the chafe marks on it. I like my stuff in perfect condition.Dont think i will order stuff online again soon in the near future.

ReviewTitle: FAILED DELIVERY.......................I have been shopping with Temu on a‚Ä¶
ReviewText: I have been shopping with Temu on a regular basis for a couple of years now and had no issues until recently. I placed an order and it was left on the door step, on a public pathway outside a communal door. So my parcel was never delivery to me at 8b but to number 8 out on the street. Temu after sending several messages to them and only ever receiving an automated reply telling me that it was delivered to the correct address, will not give me a refund nor will they resend the parcel. I have had to order and pay for the parcel again and I am going to continue to fight and go to court if need be to obtain my refund.I have been intouxh with the courier who is trying to assist with this issue but they say temu need to refund and not them even though they left the parcel on the street outside.Shame on you Temu üòï

ReviewTitle: I give 4 stars because srilanka curior company CEPEX steals temu parcels
ReviewText: I gave 4 stars because, the Temu company is very good, products are good. I have ordered so many products the last 6 months, However, since recently my packages have not been delivered by the Srilankan courier company CEPEX. This company doesn't have a registered office, nor do they answer calls. I feel CEPEX is stealing our packages. Once they collect the parcel, they stick to it, and do not deliver. Temu has refunded my money, however, I was waiting for over a month for the parcels. It's very dissapointing when this happens.

ReviewTitle: 1st time Temu user
ReviewText: okay, so I recently purchased a number of woodworking related items from Temu, and too be truthful, I was worried about the quality, this being the first time I've used them but I've seen a number of YouTube videos in relation to them, so thought that I would give it a go.Their advertising is a bit tacky, and I still have to work out what all their offers actually mean, especially the free ones (the only free thing I got was delivery).That said, most of the items I received are very good quality, especially when you take the price into consideration.The aluminium alloy items are solid, accurate, and excellent value.The wooden handles are not the highest quality, but they will do the job and are pennies, not pounds.As highlighted in several YouTube reviews, the main concern is the packaging, or should I say, lack of protective packaging. Get that right, and I will be buying a lot more items.I have already ordered several more items but purchased only certain products, being cognisant of the packaging issues.Despite these issues, the quality and price mean that it's 5 stars

ReviewTitle: Love it
ReviewText: TEMU are by for the cheapest for nearly everything don't get me wrong there are a load of rubbish items but for instance an A4 plastic box not the best quality and the latches are naff but it's for keeping printer A4 paper in when you open a fresh pack it's crap but actually really handy keeping the rest in so it doesn't bend up or get dirty but there's also a lot of hidden gems for next to nothing money, plenty of tools which are pretty well made, clothing seems to be nothing but polyester but that's fine buy me there just like gym shirts quick drying and best of all if you hang them up after throwing them in the tumble dryer you don't need iron them and for ¬£3.50 a time you can't go wrong, memory foam trainer inserts are pot luck but for a quid I've had some nice ones and the others I'm not fussed about. Plenty of Nik Naks pipettes, sticky wall hooks, metal/plastic garden hose adapters, all types of washers even replacement ones for my garden pump sprayer, pressure washer attachments even usb c fly zappers you name it some are better than others but that's life, I do look through eBay and Amazon or Google items and I've only found one item cheaper on eBay and that was a stand for my Dyson V8 absolute but Dyson tools are cheaper on Temu most fit well one was slightly tight to fit but half the price compared to a Google search. There are some promotions you can get for shopping with them like ¬£8 off ¬£50 or there show you a page of discounts the trick is if you browse and find something you want do a search for that item and your have a page full of the exact same item but for pennies or pounds cheaper and once you've ordered, it can take a week to 10 days as it's shipped from china some are quicker as it's shipped by land tracked and you can look on Temu and see when it departs/arrives at airport and so on I've had 15/20 orders all turned up okay and you can click on your orders even after delivery for a price adjustment and if the person or Temu selling the item drops the price you can get 3p 30p paid back into your account for every item that's had a price drop and sending items back is a doddle just print off a returns label or do it at post office for post office or evri drop off point sometimes if it's only pennies they just don't bother asking you to send it back and you can just throw it away. There is a promo where you get an amount of credit back to spend picking the items from a page but it's in vouchers like spend ¬£30 get ¬£2 off I did it once then couldn't find the vouchers and to be honest I thought it would have been cash paid back into my Temu account but no, so avoid that one shows up in green but the rest are pretty good I've found items for ¬£19.99 with a promo they cut the price in half so save it for your most expensive item. I don't understand some of the reviews about things not turning up my evri driver is such a nice guy I don't think there having problems with Temu as it's all tracked but maybe the delivery guy or area there living in parcels are being robbed and so on I've not had a single issue.

ReviewTitle: Temu are ok generally
ReviewText: Temu are ok generally, some orders (free gifts etc..) can take weeks to appear yes. Some packages/items have been damaged but refunds have been offered etc. What I don't like is that you get offers for cash back etc or free items.. and then find cash back is only available though PayPal. I don't use PayPal so no cash back is granted to me. Also free items can only be obtained if you spend money with them ¬£15 or so... So you end up buying your free items and other things you don't want, what's the point?All the items I'm offered to you generally cost approx. ¬£15 or less anyway and are repeated numerous times dog scoops food bags etc... I like Temu, generally but you only need so many of a particular item.

ReviewText: I tried to return an item as per Temu's "Free Return" policy, but now they‚Äôre refusing to pick it up from my address. Instead, they told me to use a private courier and pay from my own pocket. This is totally misleading and goes against what they promise on their website. Very poor customer support and no proper resolution!2. False Advertising About Free ReturnsTemu claims to offer "Free Returns," but that's clearly not true. I was shocked when customer support told me to arrange my own courier and pay for it myself. If you‚Äôre advertising free returns, then honor it! This experience has made me lose trust in Temu completely.3. Worst Customer Support Experience EverTemu‚Äôs customer service is useless. I requested a return for an item, and even though their policy says they offer free returns, they refused to arrange a pickup. They just told me to find and pay a private courier myself. Why lie about free returns if you don‚Äôt actually provide them?4. Misleading Return Policy ‚Äì Be Careful!Don‚Äôt fall for Temu‚Äôs fake promises. Their policy clearly says ‚ÄúFree Returns,‚Äù but when I contacted support, they refused to pick up the item. They asked me to send it back myself and cover the cost. This is not how a reliable company should treat its customers.5. Terrible Support ‚Äì Return NightmareTrying to return an item to Temu has been a nightmare. ReviewTitle: Temu stands by its products and protects you,no hassles.
ReviewText: I have ordered over 100 items with Temu. Recently I also ordered 2 devices from AliExpress.There is absolutely no comparison between the two vendors where they are equal.Temu ships almost all their products at once while AliExpress ships from each individual vendor.Temu stands by its products and at all times provides you the customer with full no hassle refund protection and a no return cost to you if it‚Äôs a legit return.AliExpress vendors sent me defective products and offered a refund if I paid and shipped the items back to China. AliExpress would then refund me the costs, maybe if your return is justified. The costs of return to China was 2.5 x the cost of the devices. After three weeks of back and forth they reluctantly agreed to a 50% refund and no return.Rather than chance spending more on a maybe refund I accepted the 50% for garbage items.Never again will I use AliExpress.

ReviewTitle: Dodge pots
ReviewText: Dog toy advertised as 22 cm long,barely 12 cm long.Not worth returning ad it would cost more in time and fuel than what I would get back.I had about ¬£8 sitting in credits on my account so used that.When that order arrives thats it.Also the amount of messages received was ridiculous. ReviewTitle: Temu needs to do a better job vetting‚Ä¶
ReviewText: Temu needs to do a better job vetting its sellers.If you place an order on Temu, there's a good chance - about 10-20% - that some items will either have missing parts or not match the description, whether in color, material, or both.No one wants to order something in a specific color or material only to receive an item that doesn't match what they selected. People search for items based on color and material for a reason - they shouldn‚Äôt receive something random that doesn't reflect their choice.Not to mention, if an item receives multiple negative reviews, the seller conveniently deletes the listing. This allows them to create a new one and continue falsely advertising, only to keep sending products that don't match the description.

ReviewTitle: Search engine is useless
ReviewText: I know EXACTLY what I want. I need a replacement for my Samsung Tab A 10.5 tablet. In our throw away world, no retailer stocks these because the Tab A was released 8 years ago. I came to TEMU, despite disliking everything about them, starting with "shop like a billionaire." Gag. However, what prevents me from buying is the intentional uselessness of the search engine. Regardless of how precise I am, the search always results in many suggestions that are not what I'm seeking. It takes a long time to find the right thing. Even then I must go through ALL of the details and specifications to hopefully ensure I am buying what I think I'm buying.In short, it is far too much work to be able to make a questionable purchase. Most of the time, like today, I give up and buy nothing, resentful about the 90 minutes I just spent trying to be a customer.Online shopping sucks. There is nothing fun or redeeming about it. My bank account has never looked better. In a world where we are all endlessly pushed to use yet another "easy to use website", I usually buy nothing. Amazon is almost as bad. Ali Baba is just sheer insanity. I've tried ordering direct from companies but the shipping is prohibitive. Now I buy in person only using cash.

ReviewTitle: I ordered a patio set through the local‚Ä¶
ReviewText: My wife and I ordered a patio set through the local warehouse and it still took 3 weeks to arrive. The table top had scratches and dents all over it, and the chairs had to be put together with screws, but the screws were not in the 2 boxes that came except in the table box, but not in the chair box. I went back to temu to get help for a return/refund and they sent one (1) fed ex label for the boxes that came. They said print the label for one box only. So I messaged them again for a second label to send the other box back, but they refused. They said I have to send the 2nd box back at my expense and they are not sending a label for the other one, even though the patio set arrived in two boxes. Trying to get help through the merchant was a waste of time. Trying to get help through temu customer service is very stressful because they were no help either.The 2nd box that we still have has the dented and scratched up table top. I even sent them pictures of the damaged table top but they do not care. The chairs were only sent back via fedex because of the ONE (1) return label. They take days to respond. Now I'm going to do a dispute with my credit card company. UPDATE: Temu will not follow up on this matter because if they were serious they would not have replied saying contact them through Temu.com or chat live because they know they trained their workers not to do a refund and give every excuse through their canned message system. Since they have a headquarters in Boston in a suite on the 3rd floor of the building they are renting out of, it is time to take this further to make headlines about how they don't take matters like this seriously, and how they have no problem keeping someone else's money and I have a damaged tabletop that they refuse to send another return label so I can't send it back like i did the chairs. Today, I received the screws in the mail to put the chairs together. I ALREADY SENT BACK THE CHAIRS LAST WEEK via their fedex return label. When we first discussed the screws with the Temu merchant they said it could take 2 weeks to a month to get them here. We don't need the screws now! The chairs are returned!!!! Send another return label for the tabletop and then refund us in full!! We should not have to pay for a return when your policy allow free returns, especially on items that arrive damaged.

ReviewTitle: I just had my first experience with Temu...
ReviewText: I just had my first experience with this company. As a moderately canny consumer, I found the website kind of hilarious - ten thousand pop-ups, massive "limited time" deals (on items that are never actually on sale for full price), random opportunities for store credits to keep you coming back, last second previously-unmentioned shipping restrictions that require you to up the price of your order just a little more, every trick in the capitalist's handbook to squeeze just a little bit more money out of you.Additionally, the quality of the products are sure to be utter garbage. For these prices, it's almost more alarming if the items look good when you finally receive them. Even Homesense fails on basic radiation and lead regulations these days, so a nameless chinese vendor offering the sun and moon for 10$ is more suspicious by default.As long as you keep in mind that there's a bunch of hidden trade-offs to even make this business model possible and treat it like it's a legal black market, you can find some cool stuff. Just do some research. I would personally avoid any category of product that'd have prolonged contact with your skin like clothes or cosmetics. Anyway, overall I'd say Temu can be a fun shopping experience if you keep in mind that it's Temu.

ReviewTitle: Pethatic Service from Temu and CPEX
ReviewText: Everything went wrong with this order. There was an unacceptable delay in shipping the goods. If that weren‚Äôt the case, they should have called me for clarification‚Äîbut of course, no attempt was made to contact me. I only received the goods after filing a complaint, which is ridiculous. ReviewTitle: A Disappointing Experience with Temu.com ‚Äì Privacy Concerns and Unresponsive Communication
ReviewText: I recently had an experience with Temu.com that left me feeling uneasy and frustrated. Initially, I was interested in exploring a potential collaboration with them, as their platform seemed to offer some promising features and functionalities. However, what unfolded was a sequence of events that raised serious concerns about privacy, transparency, and overall trustworthiness.First and foremost, I encountered several indicators that suggested Temu.com might be engaging in practices that could be perceived as spyware. While I cannot definitively confirm this, I noticed unusual data access requests and unexplained background processes while interacting with their platform. These actions left me questioning the integrity of their operations and the security of user data. In a digital landscape where privacy is paramount, any ambiguity surrounding data handling is deeply unsettling.Furthermore, when I attempted to reach out to Temu.com to discuss potential business collaboration, I was met with silence. Despite multiple attempts to connect through their contact forms and email support, I received no response. It is perplexing that a company claiming to provide cutting-edge services would be so unresponsive to potential partners. This lack of communication not only diminished my interest in collaboration but also amplified my concerns about their overall professionalism.Another aspect worth mentioning is the opacity surrounding their privacy policies and data handling practices. Upon reviewing their documentation, I found it to be vague and lacking in clear explanations regarding how user data is collected, stored, and potentially shared. In today‚Äôs world, transparency is not just a best practice ‚Äì it is an expectation. Temu.com's failure to provide clear, straightforward information only fuels suspicions about what might be occurring behind the scenes.In conclusion, my experience with Temu.com was marked by unresponsiveness, questionable data practices, and a general sense of unease. I sincerely hope they address these issues, as their platform has potential. However, until they provide clearer communication, transparent data handling policies, and a commitment to user privacy, I cannot in good conscience recommend them. Potential collaborators and users alike should exercise caution and seek more reliable, open, and communicative partners in the tech space.
ReplyText: Hello Jan, thank you for your feedback! Temu prioritizes data security through rigorous standards and proactive collaboration. Temu's app security practices have been independently verified to meet rigorous global standards set by OWASP (Open Web Application Security Project) through their Mobile Application Security Verification Standard (MASVS). This certification, recognized by influential agencies like the U.S. National Institute of Standards and Technology and Germany's Federal Office for Information Security, demonstrates our commitment to protecting user data. These agencies set cybersecurity standards for government and critical infrastructure. Temu joins major e-commerce leaders like Walmart and OTTO in achieving this respected security milestone. In addition, Temu demonstrates its commitment to continuous improvement by inviting ethical hackers on the leading cybersecurity platform, San Francisco-based HackerOne, to proactively identify and report vulnerabilities. This bug bounty program incentivizes collaboration with the security community for a more robust system. Temu prioritizes user security by employing Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA). This additional layer of protection requires users to verify their identity beyond just a password, significantly reducing the risk of unauthorized access to accounts and personal information. Temu actively combats phishing scams and identity theft as a member of the Anti-Phishing Working Group (APWG). This global coalition of industry leaders, law enforcement, and researchers allows Temu to share intelligence and collaborate on strategies to protect users. If you need further assistance, please message us through Temu.com or Temu app live chat. We appreciate you giving us another chance to serve you. Best wishes, Temu team

ReviewTitle: I was very afraid of shopping at TEMU‚Ä¶
ReviewText: I was very afraid of shopping at TEMU because of all the negative comments I've read about it, but I decided to give it a try. I tried and I was hooked. I was shopping almost every day. Not all the items were perfect, but every single time I complained to TEMU, they rectified it with a refund or credit towards my next purchase. Their customer service is better than the USPS, the DMV, etc. I purchased many good items, from clothes to tools to flowers, to figurines, to little things that would normally cost three times as much at the local stores. There is a problem with the Asian sizing, but mostly one gets the right size by looking at actual measurements which TEMU usually provides, instead of simply going by small, medium, large, etc. I bought some really good solar lights from TEMU. Once I found a good and reliable brand, I purchased ten of the same. The other solar lights I purchased were very small and some were dead on arrival, but like I said, TEMU rectified everything. I also asked TEMU to get rid of dishonest sellers because their reputation had improved so much, they could not afford to keep dishonest sellers or sellers that did not know what quality control was. The unfortunate thing is, as soon as the tariffs hit, TEMU's prices all went up. (Trump did his buddy, Bezos, a tremendous favor because TEMU took I think 70% of the Amazon shoppers, and I was one of those shoppers). The day the tariffs hit, everything at TEMU was advertised as "local" and "no import charges". Unfortunately, that is not true, especially that I am retired and I do nothing but cruise the TEMU website every single day. I see every little change. All the prices went up, obviously because of the tariffs. The other bad thing is the threshold to get free shipping is $30.00 PER SELLER, not from the entire TEMU website. One has now to buy two or ten of everything in order to reach that threshold. Yesterday, I had a pair of denim pants in my cart for $28.00. I would have to get two pairs in order to get free shipping or look for something else I could buy from "the same seller", and there was nothing else I wanted to buy, so I just deleted my order. I'd just as soon go to TJMaxx for about the same price and no shipping charges. I miss shopping at TEMU. I miss the convenience and the fun of it all. I used to shop every day. The day the tariffs hit and the prices went up plus the shipping charges became unavoidable, I hit the brakes. I haven't purchased anything from TEMU since. TEMU should at least give free shipping for a total purchase of $25.00 from any TEMU seller , otherwise, TEMU will not survive. Amazon gives free shipping for a total purchase of $35.00. TEMU can offer free shipping for a total purchase of $25.00 and it will keep TEMU in the competition. I don't think I need to shop for anything at TEMU again, but I will gladly shop again if they fix their free shipping threshold and become more competitive than they are now.6/1/25 -Addendum- I ordered three different kinds of saw from TEMU. A huge box arrived with a much smaller box inside. Inside that smaller box was the 18 inch saw I ordered. The other two were missing. I complained to TEMU and I was offered a refund which I took. Still bothersome that I ordered just three items and I get an update showing the three items were delivered, but two items were actually missing. Still, it is not a loss because TEMU gave me a refund for the missing items. 6/2/25- Addendum -I purchased a cherry tree "seedling" from TEMU in early April. The description also mentioned about it coming from a three year old tree. It seems to be more of a "cutting" than a seedling really. The ad showed a flourishing cherry tree with lots of fruits. It arrived later than the promised time frame. TEMU was great in sending me the $5 compensation for late delivery. When I finally got the cutting, I planted it and waited for it to show any signs of growth. Now, I have 24 fruit trees blooming and bearing fruits in my backyard. I know how to plant trees. This cherry cutting arrived with tiny buds which gave me hope it would grow into the beautiful cherry tree shown in the ad. I waited for a month. No growth signs. Two months later, the tiny buds were starting to fall off. I thought of waiting for another month because there was a 90 day return window, but the top of the cutting had discolored and looked dead. I decided to go ahead and asked for a refund. This was definitely a dud. The seller refused my refund request. TEMU allowing this seller to steal $27.00 from me is very unfair. What happened to the seller's 90 day return window? 6/3/25-Early this morning the two missing saws were delivered! Told TEMU to charge my credit card for them. Chat/AI keeps asking what my problem is.

ReviewTitle: Cheap rubbish but good shipping
ReviewText: I've used AliExpress for many years but never Temu until a couple of weeks ago. Annoyed by their utterly ridiculous introductory savings quoted at over ¬£250 for a total of nine items (mostly plastic). The delivery was very quick (under a week) but the items were all generally flimsy cheap plastic and just about worth the introductory price I paid (only about ¬£30). No way on earth would they be worth anything like what they claimed. I did expect this though as Temu has gamified the shopping experience and tries to tempt you to buy more Chinese plastic trash, shipping via air freight and helping to destroy the environment a little more. If the EU and UK do follow the US and remove the import duty on small value items, Temu and Ali etc will die out pretty quickly I suspect.So my first experience was average. Good shipping but cheap c*** products. Unlikely to use again.

ReviewTitle: Beware of unfair practices with temu‚Ä¶
ReviewText: After purchasing more than 100 items from Timu, I‚Äôve noticed when there was a flagpole that should be 30 feet and it stood no more than 8 feet was defective. They never provided a return shipping label after spending 9.8 hours messaging with PayPal and team affiliate no refund or return shipping label was provided for the defective item. They are not a trustworthy company. I also purchased an impact drill gun and they sent me a drill gun when I informed them day one that I never opened the box and I want to get the right item, they did not provide me with return shipping label. They said they‚Äôre going to escalate the matter. I reached out to PayPal and made a claim only to find out. They only deal with items that are not received and if they provide tracking, that‚Äôs good enough for them. They don‚Äôt get involved with refunds or return shipping labels I reach back out to Teo saying hey I received the item like I said it‚Äôs defective. The flagpole and the drill gun was never ordered. I ordered an impact gun. They said they were going to escalate the matter without any communication. I found out that this company is being sued in a class action lawsuit. I‚Äôve also noticed some unfair practices. Guess what I found out and videotaped Items to purchase. It says click here to review items in the cart and it says thank you for your purchase. I was like hey I wanted to see the items on my cart. Wow this is pretty deceptive and I‚Äôve also became aware that they want access to your camera. For some reason. I‚Äôve also been told by my banking institution that my financial banking card was sold to people and Bangladesh and other countries affiliated with such as UK so we had to stop my card and re-issued the card. It turned out that the company is not better Business Bureau rated and has many unfair practices happening. Beware you will have no recourse with this e-commerce. They make many mistakes without due process. Take your money give you defective items or wrong items without any return shipping label that‚Äôs been 42 days. I‚Äôve tried to ship back the items from two days after purchase, May 2025 I am currently filing a lawsuit in Pasadena California for principal regarding those two items deleting the app off my phone and tell they become a better trustworthy company. I will have to do that unfortunately buyer beware of this company and the class action lawsuit that it has pending against it .

ReviewTitle: Their still OK for some things but quality lets them down
ReviewText: Whilst it's not advisable to trust anything remotely connected to the Chinese government or CCP which every company unfortunately is, I have none the less used Temu a few times for various things and whilst some bits were really handy and useful only due to price that sadly looks like its no longer the case now you can get some things cheaper on amazon or eBay that might be because the Chinese are diverting goods through other countries in a bid to bypass tariffs to reduce the cost in any way they can even some people selling selling electrical 110V lamps destined for the States on amazon UK market place knowing too well their not fit for purpose being wrong voltage!!!. such a shame the quality is so poor as there was some really impressive innovations going on over there I love their thinking :) really clever stuff but unfortunately the quality just let most things down again what a shame. As for returning goods whilst they say you can! they emphasise that your excuse for returning goods may effect if its accepted!!! I personally would not trust this offer it's vague at best and when I tried to start a return they tried to palm me off with a ¬£2.70 refund so I keep the items that cost me ¬£17 pound! like the ¬£2.70 would make the cheapness go away and make me feel better in keeping items I'm not happy with the quality!!! LOL it's such a pain that I can't be bothered to return them so I'll just bin them, Temu can keep the cash as it's probably my last time using you.again this is only a personal view through personal experience but I think I'll shop on a safer platform and pay the difference as china is getting dearer by the day and the quality still remains questionable but at least if purchased on amazon I can return without the fuss. Funny I'm waiting for some goods from Temu as I speak though its only been two weeks since ordering it, its apparently in Kazakhstan right now! must be using pony express :/.You can still get some handy stuff on Temu especially hand tools like carpentry bits but you have to be seriously selective in your choices and check it isn't already on eBay or Amazon first.

ReviewTitle: You get with you pay for
ReviewText: You get with you pay for, right? Most of the items are very cheaply made. But if you just want affordable fashion, this site is fine It's a shame as their clothes have great style, but the fabrics are very cheap. Personally I'd pay more for better fabric. Most of their clothes are prints on one side of the fabric, so if you have a high-low hem, you will see a plain white synthetic fabric beneath it. Their jewelry looks great in the photos, but are disappointing when you receive them. What looks like glass beads in the photos are just plastic and look it. Most of those 5 star ratings are because if you rate one one item in your order as 5 stars, all the other items you ordered also get 5 stars. I was going to rate a suitcase I got 3 stars because it looked like it had more metal in it than it did, but because I rated something else in my order first, it gave a both a higher rating. I'd go with what people say and not the stars. Also I don't really think Temu posts low reviews. You can't ask questions very well. While they say that you can return items, most of us aren't going to do that for a $5 item. I have bought several plastic items for the garden and had good luck with their bras and most of their tops. Clothes which aren't took form fitting are okay to buy. I bought a fleece wrap to wear on airplane trips that I would say was my best purchase. They keep offering these "free" things, I'm just not sure I'm getting any of them. Not sure if how the Tariffs will affect my future purchases.
