ReviewTitle: I requested a refund from Temu on April‚Ä¶
ReviewText: I requested a refund from Temu on April 13, 2025. They confirmed they would refund 304,000 UZS to my original payment method. However, it's been more than two weeks and I have received nothing ‚Äî not to my card, not even to my Temu credit balance.Complaint Regarding Unreturned Credit Balance WithdrawalDear Temu Support,I am writing to formally raise a complaint regarding an unresolved issue with my credit balance. On April 13th, the amount of 304,000 UZS was withdrawn from my Temu credit balance, with the promise that it would be refunded to my primary payment method (my bank card).However, until now ‚Äî despite the time that has passed ‚Äî I have not received the refund. I‚Äôve contacted support multiple times, but instead of resolving the issue, I have received various inconsistent and misleading responses.This situation is highly disappointing and unprofessional. I trusted your platform, and I expect my money to be returned as promised. I kindly request that you immediately process the refund of 304,000 UZS to my bank card, and provide me with confirmation once it is completed.If this matter is not resolved soon, I will have no choice but to escalate the issue further.They keep responding with copy-paste messages, claiming the issue is being ‚Äúescalated‚Äù and asking me to ‚Äúwait 24 more hours‚Äù every time. Their refund receipt says the refund was done in March, which is a lie ‚Äî I only requested it in April! There is no record of any refund in my bank account. Even my bank confirmed they never received any funds from Temu.I have provided proof, contacted customer service multiple times, but Temu just keeps stalling. Their support tickets are useless and give no resolution. I‚Äôm now considering legal action and filing complaints through official consumer protection channels.Warning: Do NOT trust Temu with your money. If something goes wrong, you‚Äôll be left with vague promises and no real help.

ReviewTitle: They damaged their own reputation
ReviewText: I wouldn't buy anything expensive like a stereo...or something that required high quality like headphones, but I bought numerous toys, stationary and other items and was happy with the products. They also had better service than Amazon when things arrived broken. Sometimes things arrived broken and it looked like it was the fault of the post. Temu gives me a full refund and I didn't need to return the item. This was great service. I ordered a heat lamp for my reptiles and it came with 2 bulbs, but one was already broken, Temu gave me a full refund and I didn't need to worry about the return, and I still got use from the item. Someone says something about data security? I have never been overcharged...and if Temu know where I live and what I purchase, what do I care? Now they have come out with the most scammy stupid game I have ever seen; farmland or whatever it is called. It is such a pathetic attempt to manipulate customers. I have not spent 1 extra cent but wasted 15 minutes on this thing and am disgusted by this blatant attempt to manipulate and deceive. While I thought Temu was a good company, j now think they would do anything to squeeze an extra dollar out of their customers, at the expense of their reputation. This seems like a ridiculously poor marketing move from a company that was one of the market leaders.

ReviewTitle: ‚ÄúTerrible Experience with Temu ‚Äî Ignored Rights and Faulty Product‚Äù
ReviewText: Unfortunately, my experience with ‚ÄúTemu‚Äù was extremely disappointing. I purchased a bot through their online app, and upon receiving the product, I discovered it had a clear technical defect. Due to this technical defect, the bot was lost entirely after I was instructed by the company to return it. Even though I returned all the accessories related to the product (remote control, box, and packaging), I received no response from the company.Despite providing all the details regarding the defect and returning the accessories, Temu completely ignored my communications and failed to provide any logical or professional response. The service was far from professional, and it was clear that the company refused to acknowledge any fault or defect in the product.What was even more frustrating was the complete lack of response from customer service. They did not reply to my inquiries in any meaningful way, and when they did, the responses were extremely weak. In one of the replies, an employee even made a spelling mistake when writing the name of the company itself, which raises concerns about the level of professionalism within the company.If this is the level of service available, I would not recommend this company. The customer interaction was far from professional, and the services were not what one would expect from a company of this size.I hope these issues will be addressed in the future so that customers can have a better experience. At this point, it seems Temu needs significant improvements in their customer service processes and attention to product details.

ReviewTitle: Thumbs Up!
ReviewText: I genuinely like Temu. No, I'm not expecting designer products at cheap prices, but something simple and reasonably priced. I've gotten amazing deals on a lot of items and usually at about 1/3 the cost if I went online to a "name" company for the EXACT same thing. No, everything is not a gem. Some clothing is on the tacky/cheap side or isn't made for western height/weight ratios; some products break in shipping; and some items are just...well...strange. Here's what I've found: if I have an issue, Temu will issue a refund almost immediately, you just need to provide proof (a downloaded photo). Voila! I've returned very few items and have never had a problem. When ordering clothing, I look very carefully at the photo. I can usually tell if it's worth it or not. I've gotten some great walking clothing (bright, long-sleeved shirts, colorful leggings that make me smile, etc) and t-shirts with my favorite theme-dogs. I've found products that I never knew existed and others that made my daily life a lot easier. I get a kick just flipping through the pages and seeing what's out there. Yesterday, I was able to order something that "Big Online Store" has twice failed to send...and at less than half the price. Why wouldn't I use them again and again? I know not all experiences are positive, but I've ordered quite a bit from Temu and honestly recommend it. YMMV

ReviewTitle: I‚Äôve been a loyal Temu customer and‚Ä¶
ReviewText: I‚Äôve been a loyal Temu customer and even recommended the app to friends, but after this experience, I can no longer support it. The pricing is completely misleading‚Äîitems show one price when browsing, but once you get to checkout, the price jumps up. Even after applying a "discount," the final price is *exactly the same* as the original, which makes it clear that the discount never actually worked.I reached out to customer service, but all I received was a generic, copy-paste apology. Their explanations about price changes due to promotions ending or product costs fluctuating don‚Äôt address the core issue. This is **not** a normal price fluctuation; it‚Äôs a system flaw that misleads customers into thinking they‚Äôre getting a deal.I'm now stuck waiting for a refund and honestly feel scammed. I've decided to delete the app and will no longer recommend it to anyone. This whole experience has left me extremely frustrated and disappointed. I‚Äôm sharing this in hopes others avoid the same issue.

ReviewTitle: TEMU are selling mains powered items in‚Ä¶
ReviewText: TEMU are selling mains powered items in the UK with mains plugs that have no fuse! The lead for the product becomes the fuse creating a fire hazard. TEMU are not interested in the fact that they are selling dangerous products! My email was passed from person to person but still ignored. THEY DO NOT CARE IF THEIR PRODUCT BURNS DOWN YOUR HOUSE. The UK in general depends upon ring main system rather than a star configuration hence the reason why mains plugs are equipped with fuses. The fuseless plugs on these TEMU products do not confirm to British standards!

ReviewTitle: QUANTITY with no QUALITY....
ReviewText: I have bought numerous items from Temu and here's rundown what to expect: I bought a leather jacket and a pair of dress shoes for a decent price, but both products are far from QUALITY. Here's the CATCH: I need it to send hundreds of Temu invites or Spam to friends on social media in order for me to complete 100% of the Free promotion. They also post fake messages on the promotion post that some members have already won their 10 prizes. Don't fall for this and pay a little more, get quality products and shop at Amazon.

I think it has something to do with the tariffs, because this has never happened. I feel like they take the middle man out of equation. I have saved alot of $$ with them. Like I said earlier you can't pay a little price and expect a big price item. For clothes, and toys they are awesome. You get what you pay for. .

ReviewTitle: Appalling lack of Customer care for Temu's Customer
ReviewText: An update to the below. I lodged a dispute with PayPal and I was advised to send the parcel back to an address in Parramatta NSW. I called PayPal prior to sending it to query the address as it wasn't the address that that returns usually go to and the Consultant advised this is the address provided by Temu. I sent it back to that address and provided photos of the parcel showing the address and the tracking ID. It was delivered and I advised PayPal it was delivered and the time. I got another email today from PayPal saying they want more info as Temu claim they haven't received it. I provided screenshots of the email I received from Australia Post as well as the delivery status on Australia Post's website showing it was delivered. This is appalling. They just don't want to refund the money for THEIR MISTAKE. Steer clear of this company.Further to my review below, the second request for a refund has also been denied. I dont know if this is a person denying it or a robot. It's appalling. Temu responded and provided a link to get further assistance and it took me to the website. Not anywhere for live chat or any other complaints department. Don't know if that also was a robot or human but whatever, it's a joke and their lack of customer support is pathetic. If I could give them 0 stars I would. See my original review below. I placed an order for 2 WHITE 5 drawer plastic cabinets. The order was split into 2 deliveries. One of the cabinets is white and the other was black, grey, orange, yelliw and white drawer fronts. I requested a refund and it was denied, stating the delivery was correct. I was outraged as I provided a photo clearly showing the coloured drawer fronts. I re-requested the refund and provided more pics showing the difference between the two. It's still under review. I went to their complaints section on the website and voiced my anger. I am not stupid. How can they possibly say the correct item was delivered? How is grey, black, orange and yellow WHITE???? The order clearly shows I ordered 2 WHITE cabinets. The boxes may be the same but the contents are different. Whoever made that decision, is a lazy moron and obviously didn't look at the pics, and should be sacked. I placed the order in good faith and I expect Temu to do the right thing by me. These were expensive and are crap for the price so its double the anger to be denied a refund for the wrong item that is crap. If I get a refund after my second request for a refund, I'll come back and edit my review. If they don't then I'll be disgusted with the lack of customer care.

ReviewTitle: Cheap bargains, but rip-off promotions
ReviewText: Although there is a lot of cheap stuff on Temu, they con you into buying stuff by offering you great deals and promotions.They even offer daily free stuff if you download the app, with the option to pick one item each day.But once you download the app, try to find the daily selections and you can't as they are nowhere to be found on the app, but instead you find new daily deals, if you buy a certain amount of products, then you can have these new daily deals, which may be extra reductions or savings ..... if you can ever find them again Apparently I have to elaborate on "I bought stuff from Temu with the option to pick 10 free items as a thank you, got sent the cheapest wackiest item of all the free items which I selected and told to revisit the Temu app each day to chose the next free item to be sent you me as a thank you, but can't find the other free items which I selected, only daily free bonuses, which meant buy more stuff from Temu to get extra bonuses" otherwise Trustpilot threatened to remove my review.I'm at a bit of a loss how to elaborate on this further, so if Trustpilot feel like removing my review to protect Temu getting a bad review, then so be it!

ReviewTitle: AMAZING CHOICE
ReviewText: I have been using them for the last few months, prices are excellent, choice amazing. It does take a week or so for delivery, but then i suppose that is reflected in the price. However, i'm careful what I order as returns are not like Amazon. Yesterday I was sent the wrong item, plus another item did not work how i thought it would, and a clothing item was too small. I wanted a refund and replacement for the wrong item, and was checking if possible to return the other items. I was offered a partial refund, which amounted to about 30% of the price of the wrong item. After protesting on their online chat, they gave me a full refund, which came through instantly by way of a credit (my choice). They would have a 5* star rating if say only charged AED20 to return an item if did not fit. Then I would chance order more clothes from them.

ReviewTitle: Temu Inaccurate Delivery Dates
ReviewText: I ordered 4 items on Temu on: April 1, 2025. The 4 items each showed: "Fastest Delivery 5 Business Days". Based on that as well as my experience ordering from Temu in the past I ordered the 4 items. On April 2, 2025 I received an email from OnTrac Delivery stating that my order was scheduled to be delivered on: April 3, 2025 by 9 p.m. April 3, 2025 came and went - no delivery. So I contacted Temu and was told that the order was coming for China and would arrive between: April 25, 2025 and May 20, 2025. How is that 5 Business Days? So I asked Temu Customer Service to update the 4 items to remove the inaccurate delivery date of 5 Business Days. All I have gotten in 17 days is apologies and excuses - however website 4 items still today reflect: 5 Business days. I would not have ordered these items had I known the ridiculously long delivery date! Temu doesn't seem to care about Customer Service!

ReviewTitle: A very devious website
ReviewText: 99% of the time, I give good reviews because I like to encourage people and businesses that have been a blessing to me.Sadly, that is not the case with Temu.When anybody visits the Temu website, they get the impression that, as with every other website, they can purchase the item that they want at the price on the website. I chose the item that I wanted and placed it in the cart as usual.Then, when I came to checkout, up pops a statement that 'Temu will not process orders under ¬£15' along with some items that could be added to make up that amount.I have spoken with Temu about this previously but they are still continuing with the practice.They wait until their customer has made the decision to purchase an item before trying to con that customer into - either into spending more than they wished/intended - or having to start all over again to purchase that item elsewhere.I consider this to be, at the very least, extremely unprofessional but it is also a very devious ploy.One alternative for a customer would be to purchase a second item then return it and get the money back although, no doubt, Temu will have another way round this.Temu should either inform the prospective customer in their advertisements that nothing costing under ¬£15 can be purchased on its own.Temu should get an award for the most devious website.I was pleased to receive a response from Temu who promised to look into this. As I mentioned I had taken the time to phone Temu but nothing was changed then. I would repeat my suggestion that Temu should be upfront about this (in all advertising) - On their website, there is not just a request that 'any additional items should be ordered at the same time - 'There is a demand at AT CHECKOUT that whatever the customer wants they cannot order through them unless they spend at least ¬£15. The result would be heavier 'unwanted' parcels going through the postal system. I haven't come across any other website with this policy. I left my items in the basket because I had no intention of spending ¬£15 when the items I wanted cost ¬£7.99 - I haven't got ¬£7 to spend on things that are not a priority to me.
ReplyText: Hello, thank you for your valuable feedback. To support our commitment to sustainability, we encourage customers to meet a minimum order value so that we can more efficiently utilize the available packing space from bags, to our shipping boxes, and containers. By fully allocating the available packing spaces, we reduce the number of boxes used and number of trips made for our deliveries, which helps to reduce carbon emissions to the environment. However, we understand your concern about the policy and will share your feedback to our team for further review. Thank you for helping us understand and serve our customers better. Best wishes, Temu team

ReviewTitle: Ridiculous Website & App - Full of Fake Promises.
ReviewText: I bought ball bearings marketed for "industrial machinery" which should have been extremely strong. The size was 6.35mm which are used in bike wheels which is what I used them for.After 3.6 miles (measured on my bikes odometer), the front wheel suddenly went very tight as though the brakes were sticking, and then a loud snapping sound which was the quick release which held the wheel on. This all happened in literally 2 seconds, so I had no time to brake and come to a safe stop.Once the quick release snapped, the wheel became very loose, causing me to lose control of the bike and crash. Fortunately I landed on the grass verge and did not end up in the road as I would have ended up hurting myself on tarmac, or even worse getting hit by a vehicle.There is no option to contact the seller of the ball bearings through Temu website, so I emailed them directly on 2 occasions using the email address on their company details, but they've not responded.I also reported this issue to Temu 7 days ago, informing them I need to make a claim for damages as the product failed, and I made it very clear I use my bike nearly daily so it needs to be resolved ASAP, but every time I ask for an update, they always say they are looking into it.-----Tonight when I signed in to the app I had the cup and ball game to get rewards, then I had the option to redeem further coupons. I had an offer of 4 free products when I order ‚Ç¨35 of products, so I just spent literally hours looking for multiple items I wanted to buy, but I clicked the back button once too many times and now all my products and offers have vanished, and all the product prices have changed.Absolute ridiculous app that is full of false promises and constantly changing prices, so you never actually know if you're getting a good deal or not.---------REPLY TO TEMU:I have contact Temu lots of times and I am being asked the same questions over and over again. Someone needs to learn to read my emails and resolve the issue to my damaged bike ASAP because it's getting ridiculous now.

ReviewTitle: Well Temu again screw things up again.
ReviewText: Well Temu again screw things up. I order a Duvet, it arrives with a cut in it, so asked for another to be reshipped, so they do. But! They have put someone else's address on it, and tracking show delivered to someone different! Not me! Temu does know this, but seem to be not refunding my money, just hanging on to it. I not got the replacement item, so want my money back. Why you not refunding me??? My first Duvet came cut, so no good. They send a replacement, but then send to someone else! Not my address. So told them, had enough, refund my money, will go to another seller... So Temu refund my money please???? Order Number PO-210-12272425423912771.Just to add to this, Temu sent me message saying seller did not reship item, so now it automatically cancelled. So this is 3rd week of stress, Temu can't sort my order, I get a Duvet which is cut in it, filling coming out, and they say return it! I can't, live on my own, don't drive, and disabled in wheelchair. So everything a struggle, and the duvet I got is rubbish as damaged. Why Temu, are you not refunding my money of ¬£11.39 I want my money back, and asap, because sick of this site now. Mess me about, stressed it cause me, so get this sorted, refund my money please! Well to add to this review, now Temu refuse to refund me, unless send back damaged Duvet. I can't as live on my own, disabled in wheel chair, don't drive. I have no printer, so pretty stuck. I rely on deliveries, as don't go out. So now got a Duvet with cut in, filling coming out, and sent pictures, but Temu will do nothing. Don't recommend.

I've never had a problem getting a refund on my returns. They need to offer more women's UK size 6 clothing on the site though, I see so many clothes I want to buy; but many only start at a size 8, which is too big for me. I would also like to see them sell women's COTTON pyjamas, they are all nylon which make you sweat too much when you sleep. Cotton is much better. There are so many useful household items in the site which are low priced. I enjoy shopping on Temu!

ReviewTitle: Crap products, poorly protected, delivered by morons.
ReviewText: I ordered two live mouse traps from Temu because of problem with wood mice in the garage. The first night I set them, the mouse chewed a hole through the wafer thin roof of the trap, escaped and left the trap of no use whatsoever. To be fair Temu refunded the item. I then ordered a metal humane mouse trap from Temu and when it arrived with 'couriers' Relay, it looked like someone had jumped on it. Like so much of what Temu sell, it came with out any protection from impact damage or Relay staff who don't give a damn how they handle your goods. So Temu, your prices are reasonable, but the quality of the goods, the way they are no protected and the useless couriers that you choose to use mean it is still a bad investment. Buy cheap....buy twice....or thrice !

ReviewTitle: Small errors sorted immediately otherwise spot on
ReviewText: I see people complaining about ordered what they THOUGHT was one size or quantity and getting smaller or less, you have to READ, quite often it will show up for eg "6 of" and show ¬£4 - but when you click into buy make sure you look what you are buying and make sure it is "6" and see if the price changes, you just need to look and take a little responsibility for your purchasing. Ive bought loads of things from TEMU and rarely had a problem. Ive had one parcel mislaid as it never left the UK airport according to the tracking - so they resent EVERYTHING and gave me a ¬£10 credit, then about 8 days later TWO identicals parcels turned up - they didnt want either returning. Ive had one item turn up not very well sized - they refunded without me having to return and in another Id ordered 4 of something and gotten 3. They refunded for the missing one AND gave me a credit on my account. So overall, given the amount of stuff Ive bought, very good. Ive been buying a lot of things for the garden, planting equipment etc, all comes speedily and reasonable quality and good prices. Whenever Ive had a query the HELP has assisted without issue and the return / refund process was very simple and quick. Nothing to not be happy about.

ReviewTitle: Temu is stealing from genuine artists
ReviewText: I am writing this is an illustrator selling prints. Temu is full of stolen work from genuine artists around the world. If you buy anything from here you are stealing a living from the person who actually made the work, and giving money to individuals, most often based in China, who shamelessly screenshot artwork from the internet and pass it off as their own, and lie about the fact that they created it. Every few weeks now, I have to waste time with the limited resources that I have to scour through Temu's website and report sellers who have shamelessly stolen my work to try and profit for themselves. Temu claim that they 'vet' their sellers. But clearly they do not, and they just respawn and do the same thing over and over again. It is like a game of 'whack-a-mole' and killing off the creative industry of illustrators and print makers.

ReviewTitle: For me, the best so far, price-quality-novelty shopping experience
ReviewText: For me, the best so far, price-quality-novelty shopping experience. It does take a while for the delivery to come but for me it's no problem because you can get many things that you won't get anywhere else in UK. At the time I am writing this review, I already had about 10 deliveries from Temu, all within the estimated time with no problems, no missing or damaged items. All items received were excellent quality for the price. I even returned items in value of about ¬£80 because I got the size wrong for shoes, clothing and others. I have received the refund on my card in about 7 days with no exception. For some low value items I have opted for refund in credit into Temu account which I received in seconds without the requirement to return the items. I haven't returned anything due to quality issues. So far, I have ordered items in value of a couple of hundred pounds. I found products made based on ingenious ideas which I didn't come across anywhere else. I found products of the same quality as from Amazon, but at least twice cheaper. So, it all makes sense. Amazon delivers lightning fast but you pay for it. To be honest, in purchase value, I haven't purchased from Amazon in 6 months as much as I have purchased from Temu in one month. And to be honest again, I have started buying from Temu, not necessarily because of the price, but mostly because of the novelty, brilliant ideas and beautiful design products. I don't know where the negative reviews come from, but I am really impressed with Temu. For me, it's worth the waiting for delivery for what you get. For example, I got some bifocal reading glasses from Specsavers for over ¬£100. That is the pay for their staff pampering you and dancing around you. I got same strength glasses from Temu which look better and they are foldable, much more practical and convenient for about ¬£5. Unbelievable. My Specsavers glasses are forgotten somewhere around the house and Temu ones are on the job. Even the delivery way is better than Amazon. The courier knocks on the door and if nobody home, it will leave it with neighbours. Amazon courier got bit lazy, if you are not at home, they just drop it in front of your door, take a photo and go. Sometimes, they don't even knock or ring the bell. Recently, I have got a smart ring from Temu which costs around ¬£20. Branded ones are in the range of hundreds. It works as it should. The app on the phone is quick in syncronising and simple to use. I have washed my hands with the smart ring on many times without any problems. Never had any problems with Temu orders.

ReviewTitle: Technical glitch that no one wants to fix!
ReviewText: I live in the UK in the city called "Bognor Regis" and my postcode is "PO21 4BB". When I type my address into Temu system I see error saying "We don't ship to PO Boxes". What PO Boxes? PO21 4BB is not a number of a PO Box, it's my home postcode where I live! System recognises letters PO in my postcode and thinks I typed PO Box number when in reality it's my home postcode. So I can't order anything from Temu at all. I tried reaching out to customer support twice. Honestly it felt like I spoke with robots. They just keep sending me generic messages that "yes we don't ship to PO Boxes". Emmm, hello? Do you even speak English? There is no PO Box in my address, just postcode starting with the same unlucky letters PO.No one cares. Waste of time! I will keep ordering from Shein and Aliexpress instead.

ReviewTitle: Allows other people to use your email address
ReviewText: Some random person has set up a scam Temu account using my email address. It looks like a classic fake review situation - an item ordered for 1p to some UK address. I never verified this email, and the email account itself is secure with all sorts of 2FA and a strong password and no sign of unauthorised access. You would think that if someone did not verify the email they signed up with, they would not be able to create an account and order. However, some weeks later I start getting emails that this account *has* been set up and someone has ordered something with it. I have contacted Temu about this and they are just taking me in circles, I have been emailing them for days and they just keep telling me to log into the account to unlink my email.I've tried explaining it is not my account, it's a scam account, it's an unauthorised use of my email etc and it is falling on deaf ears. They suggested I just reset 'my' password but I can't because there is a 2FA phone number on this account. Surely if an email address has *never* been verified their system should acknowledge a request from the exact same email address asking to be removed? Why can no-one work this out? Why do they allow orders and 2FA to be set up for an email address that was never verified? Why was there no email notification that 2FA was set up etc?Surely this is a widespread issue with all the fake reviews, why do they have no idea how to do anything about it?Edit: just look at the reply as to how little they care - my complaint is that the normal support process doesn‚Äôt work. Don‚Äôt just tell me to contact support again, do something about it!

ReviewTitle: It's actually not bad!
ReviewText: I don't think Temu is a scam at all. I did before I actually tried it for myself. I was extremely sceptical and avoided it for ages. But my sister kept turning up to family events in these great tops she said she'd bought from temu and so I got curious. Since dipping my toe in the temu app, I have to concede I have only had positive experiences. I have stuck with clothing only, at least for now, beginning with a few nighties because I thought if they arrive and it's obvious I wasted my money then lesson learned and no real harm done. But I loved the nighties! Although the fabric is a little thin, they are so colourful and comfy and they wash pretty well too. So then I tried a few tops and blouses for work. Again, no issues. The quality is actually pretty reasonable (thinner fabric though and may need ironing once washed) and the range and variety are impressive. Prices are low and there are often offers of further discounts once items are in your cart. Delivery is pretty quick as well. I really don't have anything to complain about. All my orders have arrived and I'm enjoying wearing the clothes I've purchased. Temu is ok I think. So far so good.

ReviewTitle: Sometimes the laughs you get from a failure are worth much more than the money
ReviewText: First off, this isnt an actual review of TEMU but for one of the products it represents, i think is called zsrxmotion sporting goods. But For 9 bucks, what should I expect? I wasnt expecting a competive top of the line set of darts when i saw them. I was looking for a cheap, different barrel type and weight for practice. I know there were many other, much cheaper options, but none of them were electroplated in Candy apple red. When I received them, At first glance, the moment i opened the package, i laughed pretty hard. I couldnt wait to show my dart buddies later. That evening I presented the Darts in all their Red glory. After a roar of laughter and about 30 minutes of clowning my match began. In the very first game, during the First throw, the needle on my second dart tip broke. After even a much bigger laugh, we paused the game and without an extractor tool we figured out how to remove the tip and reinsert the leftover tip back into the barrel and continued the game. Prior to the game I opted for the shorter secondary "nylon" shafts provided. Although my accuracy was not as precise as usual, I was surprisingly pleased with my performance in the match at this point as i had a commanding lead heading into the 15s . 1st dart 15, second dart 15, 3rd dart 15. but the flight fell out and as I went to reinsert it the shaft had split broken.. more laughter... I replaced it with an integrated and continued. My next few throws were off, missing the bullseye by cms but eventually I easily won that particular match. Later I had to replace a second shaft that broke as well. All in all I bought them to test different weights and barrel configuration. My skill won the game but the pure comedy of these darts made the night. i would have paid 100 bucks for the entertainment but instead I paid less than 10 bucks for a great memory. Thank you Funny Dart company for the laughs and great April fools joke. Oh.. and I don't recommend these darts, unless you like the color red and you need a good laugh. i wish I had video. The 5 star rating is for the experience and pleasure. the Darts themselves, although functional to a point, get a ZERO star rating. I didn't realize they sold single use darts, kind of like a condom. 1 star.

ReviewTitle: üö® DO NOT BUY FROM TEMU ‚Äì DANGEROUS PRODUCTS & TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE! üö®
ReviewText: I ordered an earring from Temu, and after wearing it, my tragus piercing got infected, started bleeding, and caused extreme pain. It was the worst 10 minutes of my life trying to remove it! This is a serious health risk, and Temu clearly does not check the safety of their products.When I reported the issue, Temu refused to take responsibility. Instead of offering a real solution, they gave me a small coupon, which is insulting after the pain and damage I went through. They even ignored my emails and called me the wrong name multiple times in their responses, showing how little they care about their customers.If you value your health and money, DO NOT TRUST TEMU! Their customer service is a joke, and their products can be dangerous. I will never shop from them again and I urge others to stay away.#TemuScam #UnsafeProducts #BadCustomerService #DoNotBuy

ReviewTitle: Do not be influenced by promotions for expensive items in multiple item shipments.
ReviewText: My single order for 6 items was separated into two deliveries. One delivery was fast. The other included two binoculars delivered in a plastic bag and was late. The binoculars were trashed in the unacceptable packaging and each one was missing different advertised extras. Temu accepted the return. However the complex calculated value for the binoculars significantly benefited Temu. This catalog business has great advertised prices with unusual products, some obviously sold before and a deceptive refund policy, which significantly benefits the seller.

ReviewTitle: Baiting tactics
ReviewText: So many annoying pop-ups within the app. NO I DO NOT WANT THE SPIN THINGY. They always pretend like the first time you fail or get double to entice you further and the next time you spin you always land on the highest reward...to make it seem like ur SUPER lucky, it's just rigged already. Better yet, they promise you all these rewards and cash back but you NEED to spend hundreds of dollars to earn a small amount. They promised me $100 cashback if I earn 100 tokens, yeah I spent like $10 and got 97 tokens already and what's next, I need to spend $300+ dollars to get the remaining 3 tokens as it is a pyramid scheme with lower rewards the closer you get to actually getting the reward. So much bait and catch tactics used by the company, and there is absolutely no way to opt out. other than that the prices are relatively cheaper because you wait more vs the other trillion-dollar-company.

ReviewTitle: This is the worst e-commerce platform‚Ä¶
ReviewText: This is the worst e-commerce platform with the lowest rating I have ever joined, but this is the first and last order, and no more. On 30 March 2025, I purchased (or at least I tried to purchase) a kerosene stove and paid ¬£55 through PayPal. The next day, on 31 March 2025, I received an email from PayPal saying that I received a refund from temu.com. Not knowing what happened and why, I have contacted Temu Customer Service on the same day (31 March 2025) to find out as to why my order was cancelled and the money refunded. To my astonishment, they said, I quote,"We regret to inform you that your order ‚Ä¶ has been refunded due to unusual payment activity. We kindly suggest trying an alternative payment method to proceed with your transaction."I found it terribly disappointing. I paid with PayPal, but they then refused it "due to unusual payment activity", which could not be farther from the truth. Fortunately, I paid with PayPal, which is a reputable and secure online payment system that I used for about ten years, or else they would have screwed me. In my opinion, this is the reason why they suggested an alternative payment method, which probably would have caused me a headache to sort out and get a refund, but they could not screw PayPal.Reading the reviews of this platform on Trustpilot, I am utterly shocked, but thankfully I am not a victim. It would have been even more shocking if I were to lose money. It's worth reading the reviews, so I am really thankful to Trustpilot for running a review website where scammers and indecent platforms can be identified. There are many scammers out there these days, so I am now vigilant.

ReviewTitle: Package never delivered
ReviewText: I placed an order on March 14, 2025. On March 25 I received a tracking notification from SpeedX that the package was "Out for delivery." It never arrived. On March 25 I received a second notification that it was "Out for delivery." It never arrived. On March 31 I received a third notification, but again it never arrived.Later in the day on March 31 I received 2 more notifications, one saying "Attempted Delivery:Building Closed" and the other, "Attempted Delivery: No access."This is a lie. It is an 8-story apartment building. It is NEVER closed, and you can always access it. I have had hundreds of dollars of Temu merchandise delivered to my building without problem. I disputed the charge for this order with my credit card company, and it was removed.SpeedX is a scam delivery company with a horrible track record. Now that Temu is using them, I will never order anything else from them. It's a shame because I really enjoyed shopping on Temu. No more. Not worth the hassle.

ReviewTitle: **THIEVES - DO NOT TRUST THESE COMPANIES**
ReviewText: Your apology seems to be worthless, as I still haven't heard from you. I would appreciate getting my money back. Thank you!I purchased a few high-priced items from TEMU, but not all of them were delivered, and TEMU has not refunded me.I had a very troubling experience with LIFEIDEAS. The LUNO delivery man left my parcel in an insecure location, which led to it being stolen by the LIFEIDEAS delivery man when he came to my house to deliver my sofa. I was not at home at the time. He noticed a parcel from LUNO (a mattress) in my hallway, falsely claimed it belonged to LIFEIDEAS, and took it. My neighbour witnessed this; the driver was in a white pick-up van with the registration KV69 ZNS. When the driver returned to deliver the sofa, I confronted him, and he apologised, claiming he had taken the mattress to the LIFEIDEAS warehouse.I do not trust these companies; I believe LIFEIDEAS is a thief, and TEMU and LUNO will not take responsibility for stolen items. I strongly advise against using their services unless you want to risk having your hard-earned money taken from you. I have photos of the driver and the van, and I am currently seeking legal advice.As a result of this incident, I had to purchase another mattress, which cost me an additional ¬£100.

ReviewTitle: l am very pleased with Temu
ReviewText: l am very pleased with Temu, as I have the opportunity to carefully select my purchases and have been approximately 90% satisfied with the products that l bought. However, I am extremely disappointed with the delivery service they have chosen in England, which is Evri. It is, frankly, a very poor choice, and its inadequacy is difficult to overstate. I struggle to comprehend why such a problematic delivery partner was selected.Over the past 18 months, I have consistently experienced delivery failures ..Even products I have ordered have been returned multiple times. Despite changing my delivery address to my workplace on main Street, they are still unable to complete deliveries there. This is perplexing, as I have been raising these concerns for the past six months. I have requested that Temu use an alternative delivery service for my orders, but their responses have been clich√© apologies.They continue to insist on using Evri for my deliveries, which then necessitates me spending at least three to four hours tracking down my purchased items. I am thoroughly fed up with the difficulties in receiving my deliveries; it is truly exasperating. While the overall Temu experience is excellent, it is significantly undermined by the poor choice of Evri as their delivery partner in England. I simply do not understand this decision.Furthermore, Evri's customer service offers only one option via phone and online chat: entering your tracking number. The automated system then states that the item is out for delivery, promises the next delivery attempt for the following day, and abruptly ends the interac

ReviewTitle: In my opinion the quality is very good for the money
ReviewText: I honestly can‚Äôt believe the bad reviews that temu get. I have got nothing but praise for this companyI started using them a few years ago, I‚Äôve bought just a couple dresses the first time I was extremely impressed, I‚Äôve washed them. I‚Äôve worn them. They‚Äôve dried within 20 minutes and I get quite a lot of comments. I don‚Äôt understand why the reviews are so bad. I order roughly ¬£20-¬£50 worth each time and if there‚Äôs anything ever wrong I can return the item on occasions when I‚Äôve not been happy with something they‚Äôve told me to keep it and they still give me a refund. I don‚Äôt know any company that would do that. I find their dresses beautiful they‚Äôre long their floaty for the money. I get more compliments on their stuff than I do my expensive stuff so all I can say is for me, I‚Äôve not had a problem and I‚Äôve got many many dresses. I‚Äôve just ordered another parcel with six dresses come to 50 quid You can‚Äôt beat it and they do look amazing. I get many comments. I‚Äôm sorry if you disagree. I‚Äôve bought for my my holiday which I won‚Äôt just wear just yet.I‚Äôve returned maybe five things in the whole term that I‚Äôve been buying stuff that‚Äôs how impressed I am. I‚Äôve bought a blanket with bichon frize on it. I‚Äôve bought a little clip that holds my hat on the bag. I‚Äôve ordered another clip that goes on the suitcase to hold your coat or cardigan. I‚Äôve ordered some caps. I‚Äôve ordered lights for the garden. I‚Äôve shoehorns the long ones cause I hurt my leg recentlyI‚Äôve bought some little metal posters for the garden so you can see by what I‚Äôm saying. I‚Äôve bought an awful lot. I bought a couple of micro towels for my holiday because they don‚Äôt take up much room I bought a lead for the dog. I wasn‚Äôt particularly happy with that but they refunded it. I bought a pair of shorts but because my arse look fat but they still refunded it so I‚Äôve only got good things to say about them I‚Äôd give them 5 out of 5.

ReviewTitle: I am giving Temu one star because even‚Ä¶
ReviewText: I am giving Temu one star because even though customer service does answer the phone, they are not very helpful. I had an issue with an item that I purchased and I returned it (it was used, scratched up, and missing screws) and I sent it back. However, I have to wait until they receive it and inspect it before I get a refund. And customer service didn‚Äôt even offer me a coupon! On top of that, I noticed that the promos and coupons you receive are driven by your purchases and if you make a return, they take them away!!! Even though I‚Äôve purchased over 150 items and returned only 2!This is a SCAM and I will no longer shop Temu. I‚Äôll just use Amazon; I get my stuff faster anyways and they will give me my refund as soon as I drop off the package, not when it goes through their BS process!Temu, you‚Äôve just lost a good customer.Buyer‚Ä¶.BEWARE!

I had a similar experience with many other items I bought.Terrible quality. Awful service.

ReviewTitle: Nightmare on TEMU Street!
ReviewText: The item sold to us: Two defective rubberwood barstools. The problem: The chairs were victims like us from an obvious lack of quality control at the high volume factory, with no actual visual inspection, and ditto at the Temu warehouses. Right out of the box, after opening the carton to remove the parts, sharp splinters of wood mixed with the packaging penetrated like quills penetrating my skin. I recoiled but not before the broken edges of a bolted cross brace cut my fingers. (See photos) My fingers had to be treated and lightly bandaged. The splinters had to be removed carefully. My husband had to help with my cuts and then he cautiously took photos of some of the broken pieces. My husband who knows furniture well examined the whole mess further. The back rests were warped from lack of proper aging of the rubberwood laminates. Rubberwood has high sap content and needs to be aged properly to remove unwanted moisture. Otherwise, you get warping and even bleeding of the wood if damaged. My husband continued to examine the pieces. Critical bolt mounts and holes would not align as a result of the improper aging or drying. The bolt mounts were scored into the warped back rests making assembly totally impossible. The bolts were too far out of alignment to connect the parts. Center braces of each chair came bolted for shipping, which were too cracked and unsafe to use.Imagine the horror of splinters of wood in your own fingers. And blood on your skin and jeans to round out this review. My husband worked in a furniture factory so has experience and firsthand knowledge of construction and assembly. We have both tried unsuccessfully for three weeks to alert Temu of the safety issues and get a refund. I will end this part of the review with one word, NIGHTMARE. This Temu furniture jack-in-the-box sprung a bad dream on us. But the nightmare had only just begun! Everything that was wrong with the chair was true about Temu customer service! We encountered fragmented help. No part knew the other part. Splintered conversations. We experienced misaligned customer service representing the vendor who blamed us. ("Human error.") "We won't replace the item" and offered a few bucks in consolation instead. Then the nightmare got worse, darker. Broken promises. "Yes, dear customer, we will resolve this. We understand your deep suffering and frustration." But instead of getting a replacement or a refund from Temu customer service, we went in circles getting nowhere. That is what Temu Circle Members pay for? A runaround! Even Temu customer service couldn't deal with this nightmare because their unvetted vendor actually sold broken chairs, which caused real physical injury. I feel sorry for their inability to just simply issue a refund. They kept promising, but their words were twisted. Amazon would have refunded it. And to compound matters, the box and packaging came torn, broken, in pieces, not usable for a return. UPS would not accept. Plus, warehouse inspectors could be injured, as well, hands blindly inspecting. Even possible wood splinters in the eyes, God forbid! My husband suffered a corneal laceration from fine wood debris getting in his right eye. It was red and tender like something was in the eye for days just from moving the stool parts to the garage and covering the broken parts with heavy plastic. For us, who are paying "Temu Circle Members", I guess you get what you pay for. We have been running in circles for weeks. It's been Catch 22 and DeJa'Vu over and over again. Think about the situation. What is wrong with this picture? It is not an isolated experience for us and so many others.Questions to consider. Is TEMU selling a lot of products to the US that would have been rejected under real quality control in China? Does TEMU consciously make it so frustrating to get a refund that you simply just give up trying? Is that the model? See our review on TEMU with the "bloody photos." Search for the item number and vendor. This is a real encounter with TEMU and not for the faint of heart.Item# KP1069452. Our order number: PO-211-09246980804393106 Vendor: Period Furniture.

ReviewTitle: Don't be fool with credit Temu offers

When you are offered credit it will be in parts, for each part you have to spend certain money in order to use that credit. For example I was offered credit of 30¬£ if I spend 40¬£. As a naive person I spent 40¬£. And Temu offered me credit of 30¬£ as 0.7¬£, 0.7¬£, 3¬£,6¬£ 7.5¬£ ....=30¬£ so for each credit like 0.7¬£ you should spend again at least 15¬£ to use your 0.7¬£ credit , so in order to use your all 30¬£ credit you have to use at least 300¬£. Very clever Chinese, I won't trust it and the price of product are almost same as Amazon, with Temu there is no return for your money they will make millions of excuse in order to avoid refund.with Amazon at least you are safe

ReviewTitle: I've used Temu for a while now and its been fine. Good value reliable service.
ReviewText: I've used Temu for a while now, placing several orders in that time and not experienced any problems. They've delivered a couple items that were broken on arrival. I recorded a problem and was given an immediate credit - so good service there. Also had one delivery that arrived after the stated delivery date and they gave the promised ¬£4 credit without me having to complain. The products are mostly good quality, only a couple which were poor quality. It can be difficult to buy clothes online as sizes can be hard to determine. Household products have all been good, including the resin and contact adhesives.Delivery times from UK suppliers is quite quick, a couple of days to a week, but usually add a small charge for delivery. Those sent from China do take a while, but if they are travelling by ship that is to be expected.Some people have warned that they install spyware with their app. That has not been my experience, unlike Facebook and the other big social media companies who I steer clear of. Not seen any increase in spam mail or other problems. I don't use their app, but always go online to their website to make up an order.Overall, I am satisfied with their product quality and service standards.

ReviewTitle: I purchased a Hermitlux counter top‚Ä¶
ReviewText: I purchased a Hermitlux counter top dishwasher on March 8, 2025 for $170 based on a sale. Item was supposed to be shipped locally meaning based in the US. Item was supposed to be delivered no later than March 18th. They provide tracking information and according to UPS Hermitlux was supposed to ship item but they only printed a label. On March 17th I reached out to both Temu and Hermitlux to inquire why item still hadn‚Äôt shipped. I got apologies and Hermitlux responded by email that it was UPS fault saying they didn‚Äôt pick up item. On March 17 UPS said item had ‚Äúarrived in CA‚Äù and they finally shipped the item. UPS said it was coming from Barron Consulting LLC which from Google doesn‚Äôt even appear to be a real company. I contacted Temu with concerns that this item was NOT in stock in the US but was really being shipped from China. They insisted it was an item based locally but couldn‚Äôt explain why item ‚Äú arrived‚Äù in CA where it was supposed to ship from. I finally received this dishwasher on March 24th. You can manually add water to the top ( it requires THREE 1.8 liters of water to start running. Well, after it started the wash cycle it flooded my kitchen with water SPILLING OUT OF THE BOTTOM PANEL . I had to grab bath towels to cover my kitchen floor while I ran to unplug this unit with my feet in water! I contacted Temu they wanted video proof! Like I‚Äôm going to risk being electrocuted and start this machine again so more water can spill over my counter and unto my floor. Now I have to return this crap. I also contacted Hermitlux and they said it happened because of ‚Äú violent transportation‚Äù by the shipping company! They are supposed to pack this item for transport! Now I have to ship this crap back while my $170 remains in limbo. But get this, I looked for a plate or sticker with a serial number to have them check to make sure I wasn‚Äôt sent a damaged or returned unit and item has NO sticker NO plate nothing with a serial number or model number or electric voltage information! I have no idea how they were even able to sell this item in the US! Buyer beware.‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî-////Reply to Temu 3/26/25 you should have no problem finding my order. It was placed on March 8, 2025 for the Hermitlux Counter Dishwasher. As already stated I have had extensive conversations with your customer service department regarding this matter. I have also started the return process and UPS will pick up package on Saturday then it will probably take you 2 weeks or more to issue my refund. How you can sell an electronic item with no model number, serial number or electric voltage/ watt is shocking and suspect illegal and not allowed in the US.,RETURN UPDATE 3/29/25 ‚Äî//////Temu scheduled a pick up with UPS to retrieve this malfunctioning dishwasher for today 8-12pm . I got a UPS tracking number and confirmation of scheduled pick time etc from Temu . Guess what they never scheduled any pickup! I called UPS after no one arrived and they said Temu ‚Äúpaid‚Äù for a pickup but scheduled NOTHING! So, if item is not received back by April 7,2025 I lose my $170. Pretty slick on Temu‚Äôs part . I contacted Temu again and asked for a supervisor which was refused. Shady company. Back to shopping ONLY with online US companies like Amazon. Since with TEMU you have absolutely NO RECOURSE- none.

ReviewTitle: Trouble in Temuland
ReviewText: Full Disclosure: Up to this point I have loved my experiences with Temu. I have found items I needed for resonable prices and customer service felt so much easier than Amazon plus the associates were nice.This was my first issue with the platform after 3 months of using it.Temu did not return my money even after I returned the items and asked for the funds to be returned to my original form of payment which was my card.Initially, Temu was a last resort when looking for items I couldn't find in store or for reasonable prices with other online retailers. I was pleasantly surprised when I began.I felt Temu was great. I found a number of items I liked. Really cool off the beaten path items as well as some awesome clothing pieces. At first the purchasing and return process easy, I thought this was beneficial considering that sometimes items were not as they appeared in pictures, which happens with online purchases. Most recently, in two separate orders I ordered a pair of jeans and I received a pair of circa 1970s polyester pants and my second order had several items I was returning.The first order I just needed to return the pants, the second order, I asked for a full return and I would return the items. The Temu customer service associate said: "I found a way you don't have to return the items. You don't have to worry about the trouble of returning them." Not really a problem but ok. The associate seemed insistent I not worry about returning the products. I was asked how I wanted my funds returned. I said in the original payment. I was told it may take a few days (7-14) before it showed up with my banking institution. I waited. The money never showed up. In the in-between time Temu refused to issue a return label for the pants (Temu prides itself on trouble free returns) and then the returned funds for the other order showed up... as credit in my Temu account. I contacted them again and told customer service the issue with shipping and the return. I spent almost 2 hours in a chat explaining and re-explaining the situation (it's all documented in the chat): that I never asked for Temu credit. The issue was escalated for them to tell me that they can't convert credit to cash and that I would have to pay for the shipping for an item that was nothing like advertised. This meant they were not going to honor their own protocol of providing at least 1 opportunity for free shipping/return per order.If only they hadn't issued the credit in the first place...especially since I asked for my funds to be returned to the card I used to purchase my items. The customer service associates I spoke to were very, very nice but ultimately condescending and somewhat patronizing. 'Nice' is not the equivalent of actually listening to a customer and hearing what is being said. It also doesn't mean the customer is always correct but to find a resolution where everyone feels it is a balanced outcome for the benefit of the vendor and customer.Update|May 1,2025: I have attempted 5 times to return the item since March since the initial review with a variety of factors at play: The pants have been declared 'too heavy'; UPS pickup has been arranged via Temu and have not picked up the package...all 5 times; The UPS website doesn't recognize the tracking number and the package cannot be taken to a UPS store.

Customer satisfaction is of the utmost importance and we are constantly working to improve our service quality. We will follow up on this matter. ReviewTitle: The Chinese revenge site
ReviewText: This was my third order attempt at Temu in about 4 or 5 months. The first two orders were 5 or 6 items that were all inexpensive items, that never looked or worked as good as expected from their online pictures and descriptions, but were so low price I got what I paid for. When you order from them you get lots of follow up emails for another order. Finally I opened one of the emails and they were offering me incredible discounts based on responding to the email. So I ordered a few more items (I'm a sucker for a good deal).I put them in my cart, example a portable air pump regular $28 on special $8, can opener regular $18 for $4.50 etc. They have my credit card info and shipping info so I hit the links to buy and ship. Then a pop up said you are $.50 short of $15 minimum for this order. So I ordered some blank stick-um pads for $.61 and pressed the buy link. When they sent the info on the discounts they never said there was a minimum order amount.To Make a long story shorter: A charge showed up on my credit account for just under $5 which made no sense. But it was so little I thought I'll wait till I see what shipped. about a week later I got 2 stick-um pads (even though I only ordered one) and nothing else. I went to site to see invoice and they charged me $1.22 for 2 note pads and $2.99 for freight. Needless to say I sensed "bait and switch" with the discounts offered just to get me to order again. I could not find a phone number for customer service so I got on a chat, first with a robot and then a real person. This was a total waste of over an hour. Because they could find no copy of my order for the discounted items that never showed up nor was I charged for them.Their prices are low even without the discounts, but their customer service and infrastructure is horrible.Say what you will about Amazon, who we do a lot of business with and they are the state of the art of online retail. But Temu is a disaster. Caveat emptor, buyer beware. I will never order from them again.

ReviewTitle: Time Out for TEMU
ReviewText: Ordering from TEMU was a breeze. I liked everything and saw and the prices were fantastic. Several friends ordered and that caused e to try TEMU. Problem 1 - What you see online is not the quality you receive. My shoes arrived and the construction was incomplete. The shell looked exactly like the website but inside the shoe had no insole, no padding, and no inner fabric covering the stitching. The exterior stitching was fake and actually was glued. My order came in two separate shipments. The second order never arrived it was stolen by the driver according to several independent witnesses and camera surveillance. He places the package the on porch of the wrong address, took a photo, marked the package as delivered, the retrieved it and left!! TEMU didn‚Äôt care and showed it as delivered telling me to contact the delivery company because they fulfilled their obligations. The delivery company had no contact phone number and never answered my emails. TEMU has no contact phone number as well and can only be reached by email. They take their time answering. I do not recommend them at all. Their sizes are not comparable with US sizes, and any need for a refund is work!!!!

ReviewTitle: Unbelievable level of Copyright Theft
ReviewText: This is a follow up to a previous review of Temu concerning the unbelievable levels of copyright theft on the site, with particular regards to artwork that is for sale. It is my firm opinion that Temu should be classed as a criminal organisation, and I‚Äôll explain why below‚Ä¶In my case I am an artist. Every single day I have to check on Temu to remove listings (usually posters prints, canvas prints, metal prints) which feature my stolen artwork. In this last 7 days alone, I have had to report between 50-70 new listings EVERY SINGLE DAY featuring my copyright artwork. Now, in Temu‚Äôs defence they do provide an easy to use reporting system to report copyright infringing listings, and they do usually take down those listings within 24 hours. That is good. But now unfortunately the bad!Of all the online retailers they are by far and away the most lenient when it comes to any punishment for the sellers listing these stolen items. It can take hundreds and hundreds of copyright notices before a seller‚Äôs shop is closed. Virtually all other online marketplaces will ban a seller once they're when they‚Äôve had between 3-10 complaints. Not Temu. They will allow a shop to continually and flagrantly keep posting copying infringing material until there have been many hundreds of copyright notices. Of the 450 copyright notices I had to file over the last 7 days, they are all shared between only 8 different shops. Each day those same shops keep posting new listings featuring artwork they have stolen. They don‚Äôt care. They know how to play the game. They all have multiple shops running at the same time. They know it takes hundreds of complaints before their shops gets closed. Once the shop does finally get closed after racking up hundreds of sales they just open another shop and start again, bulk uploading exactly the same listings that they had in the old shops. Wash rinse repeat. It just goes on and on and on.And what's more, virtually everything listed in those shops is copyright infringing. I took a close look at one of the sellers selling my artwork, and took a random sample of 100 listings (not including my artwork). Of those 100 listings I was able to identify over 70 listings were copyright infringing. Where possible I advised the artists concerned.Hundreds of small independent artists are having their artwork stolen on a catastrophic level by sellers on Temu. Temu is well aware of this but hide behind doing the very bare minimum in law. They could solve this problem overnight by applying much stricter rules to those sellers who breach copyright, like other online retailers do. Why don‚Äôt they? Well of course they also profit from the sales of this copyright material, so it‚Äôs not in their interest. So I ask that anyone considering purchasing any art related products (posters, canvas, metal prints etc) or objects with artworks printed on them (mouse mats, beach towels, water bottles etc) from Temu to think again. You‚Äôre more than likely financing a criminal business by purchasing artwork which has been stolen from a genuine artist. And Temu, in your response to this review, maybe rather than the same old cut and paste nonsense that you ‚Äútake copyright theft seriously blah blah blah‚Äù which is, as I have shown, a blatant lie, try coming up with an actual solution to the problem, like actually being a a lot more strict on the criminals who shops you seem so reluctant to close. Copyright theft is a crime. These sellers are committing a crime. You could easily solve this, you just don't want to. That means you are complicit in criminal activity. That is why, in my opinion, you should be classed as a criminal organisation.Shame on you Temu.

ReviewTitle: Temu is the best.
ReviewText: Temu is the best shopping app from China. I recently bought a smartwatch, expecting it to be bad, but the quality is amazing for the price. Some people mistake it for an Apple watch! Pretty crazy, right? It has the best customer service I've ever talked to! Their delivery is also amazing too. But everything isn't sunshine and rainbows. One of the most things I don't like about it is it lacks a variety of products to choose from. You could see a pair of 6 times by different sellers and nothing else. While it might be good for price comparing but what about other shoes? Other than that, its best.

ReviewTitle: Yusman F04 charger electric shock hazard.
ReviewText: I purchased a Yusman F04 car booster charger from Temu at the end of last year. So far my 6 year old grandson has had an electric shock and I have now had 2. I've contacted Temu and now they can't find the order details or any order numbers etc. I gave Jomar ( the customer service rep) my address etc and I've just had a reply that they are not going to do a thing about it. Can't find my details strangely enough. The charger isn't kite marked and is in my opinion extremely dangerous. I emailed Yusman 3 weeks ago and not heard anything back at all. Temu now have warehouses in the UK to store all their sub standard, dangerous items in. I've been in contact with trading standards and Monday I am sending the unit to them for inspection and to finally put an end to dangerous items being sold in our country. If you value you health and safety stay away from Temu. I really wish I had done.

ReviewTitle: Temu has no integrity
ReviewText: I ordered items which were delivered when I was not there. They were pirated. TEMU REFUSES TO REIMBURSE ME FOR THE CHARGES. They believe I should pay for unreceived merchandise. If it was a $5 charge I wouldn't be happy. But, I could swallow hard & eat the lose. I'm talking about over $500 for things I can't use because I wasn't there to accept them, and someone else was. Temu has no respect for customers & no integrity.Temu has sent no less than 10 emails to me. Every single one says the same thing : "Dear Valued Customer,We regret to inform you that we are unable to process your refund request as we have confirmed with the merchant that your package has been successfully delivered.Please see proof of delivery below." Then they show a picture of the box sitting in front of my door on 2/23. I continue to reply that I had canceled the order the same day i ordered it & the note indicating i was in the hospital for 5 or 6 weeks. I was released from the hospital on 3/15. Surprise, surprise. No box at my door. As of today TEMU is still positively refusing to reimburse a penny.

ReviewTitle: Beware of Teawig on Temu Platform
ReviewText: I strongly urge everyone to stay away from Teawig, a store on Temu‚Äôs platform. I recently had a terrible experience that I feel compelled to warn others about.I purchased a wig from Teawig but mistakenly ordered the wrong one after browsing several similar wigs on their website. As per their return policy, I promptly returned the wig in its original packaging without even trying it on and requested a refund. However, to my shock, Teawig refused the refund, falsely claiming that I had not returned the same wig!I‚Äôm baffled by this accusation‚ÄîI certainly didn‚Äôt have another brand-new wig lying around to swap it with. Despite explaining the situation, they still refused to honor the refund. Essentially, they have kept both my money and the wig they insist isn‚Äôt theirs.To make matters worse, their communication was condescending and unprofessional. I was addressed as ‚Äúdear‚Äù and ‚Äúlove,‚Äù which I found highly offensive and inappropriate, especially in a dispute regarding a legitimate return.This experience has shown me that Teawig operates with zero regard for honesty or professionalism. I strongly advise anyone considering purchasing from this store to think twice‚Äîyou risk losing your money and being treated with utter disrespect.

ReviewTitle: My review after reading negative reviews
ReviewText: I decided to do this review because I have been extremely satisfied, not only with the products that I‚Äôve purchased, which were many many products of different varieties, such as household, good gadgets furniture, clothing, clothing for family, and friends, such as the children items that I would think would make their lives a little bit easier have a friend who‚Äôs expecting her first child this has been an extremely enjoyable experience. If I have any issues, it is resolved within minutes as long as I have proof such as delivery issues or having items that don‚Äôt belong to me belong to someone else and immediately send a replacement item and told to keep the item that I had which is funny because of the time I was wanting such an item and it just landed on my doorstep. It belonged to someone else in a whole Nother state so apparently there was a mixup in packaging and delivery. If I have an item that‚Äôs broken they refund it. I always choose to have the refund in a form of credit because it goes towards other purchases that I make, which is great for me because it helps me with ordering a more expensive item that I otherwise would have to pay more an example that is when I ordered my automatic self cleaning cat box for multiple cats. It arrived in a timely manner, easy to work, and if I had not had all my credits and coupons added to it. It would‚Äôve cost me nearly 800 bucks easy but because of these coupons and credit that I have accumulated, I was able to purchase it for $174 and some change and I‚Äôve had it now for 11 days. It works like it says I have it programmed to my phone so it alerts me when my pets use it. It alerts me when it‚Äôs being cleaned. It alerts me when it‚Äôs being sterilized it will alert me when it needs to be changed. It would alert me when it needs to be cleaned and it‚Äôs easy to clean, which is excellent for me as I was reading these reviews from very dissatisfied customers, I don‚Äôt understand why it was such a problem for them. I‚Äôve been refunded multiple times. I‚Äôve had products replaced if it was damaged or lost I can‚Äôt say enough about Team. My experience has been excellent and I‚Äôve been with Team for quite a long time so whomever is reading this if something looks too good to be true research it which is what I do I didn‚Äôt make this large purchase on a whim. I researched it found a product on other sites for way more money. I research reviews on such products and was satisfied with the reviews and that is how I make my purchases just research what you want so that you know when it‚Äôs a good deal when it‚Äôs not a good deal. i‚Äôm sorry that the reviews I‚Äôve read that have very poor ratings that they experience was so bad. Also be aware that Temu doesn‚Äôt make all the products to me. They are just a base for other companies so the problem that they‚Äôre experienced such as not getting their refund. It‚Äôs really not coming from temu. It‚Äôs coming from the company that the product originally came from to me. I look at Temu as a huge warehouse of their own products with their own labels, but it‚Äôs also a station to order products from other companies some that are overseas. That‚Äôs where I feel the problem lies. I will continue to be a Temu customer for many years to come, and if I do have any issues that I read on here, I would deal with it appropriately, but as long as I have no issues like that, I will continue to buy there thank you Tio.

ReviewTitle: Beware, they are crooks!!!! Big time!
ReviewText: Beware! Temu will rip you off!!! If you refund an item they give you a choice, either a credit or back the way they got the money. For me it's thru PayPal. So you get you money back. But most of the time when you click to get the refund back, they will still put it to a credit. So now you have to spend more money to use that credit. Also, they send you offers. Example: they send an offer for 99.9% off. They tell you pick 3 items for a penny each. Then you see go to checkout. At checkout they tell you have have to spend $20 to $30 more to get the 3 items. It's a scam! I purchased a 4th item for $20.09. The order went thru. Later I checked the order and it was only the item I paid $20.09 for. DO NOT TRUST THEM!!!

ReviewTitle: TEMU's deceptive practices regarding‚Ä¶
ReviewText: TEMU's deceptive practices regarding their rewards and coupon system are quite frustrating. They often advertise enticing offers, such as $300 in coupons, which initially seem like a great deal. However, the fine print reveals that these rewards are contingent upon spending a significant amount of money, which is not clearly communicated upfront. Many customers, including myself, have found that after making a purchase, the promised rewards and coupons either never arrive or come with stipulations that make them nearly impossible to redeem. This lack of transparency can lead to disappointment and a feeling of being misled. Overall, while TEMU's promotions may catch your eye, be cautious and read the details carefully, as the actual benefits may not live up to the initial promise.

ReviewTitle: This site is a **partial scam**
ReviewText: This site is a **partial scam**‚Äîmeaning you will receive the product you ordered, but the **fraud lies in its quality, size, and effectiveness**. However, the **real scam** comes from the platform's management. We conducted an experiment two days ago, and here are the details: A pop-up appeared, showing an egg and a message claiming I was eligible for **six completely free gifts**. The system then ran a **fake progress animation**, stating: - "You have gained energy!" - "You have gained additional energy!" To claim the gifts, you needed to **reach 100 energy points**. Naturally, you would only reach **80 points**, at which point the system prompted you to **invite friends** to continue. After sharing the link with **three friends**, your energy increased to **98 points**‚Äîbut then came the catch. The system now required you to **invite a new user who had never used the platform before**. Once your friend installed the app, you received **1 energy point**. The next invited friend gave you **0.5 points**. The one after that? **0.02 points**. We invited **eight people**, yet the system **only counted four**. There was **no clear rule** for how invitations were accepted. Finally, the last person who signed up was told that in order to help me, **they had to go through the same process I did**‚Äîcreating an **endless loop of pending requests**, forcing users to unknowingly **advertise the platform for free** while gaining nothing in return. ‚ö† **Do not fall for the big bonus coupons!** ‚ö† They claim you will receive a discount **after making a purchase within 30 minutes**. However, once you complete the payment, you only get **a portion** of the coupon. When you check the fine print, you realize the **entire promotion is a trap**. üö® **This website is a scam.** üö® There is no need to discuss product quality‚Äîit is **extremely cheap and low-grade**. -----------------------------------------Response: I received a weak response from the site. During the past two days, I've tried the farm. Oh my goodness, this is another type of scam. Simply don't be fooled by the discounts offered; you'll spend many times more to get them.

I sent photos etc...as they requested. Then after a week of back and forth they offered me 20% off my next order OR a refund. I requested the refund....Now they email me back and state that they can not honor a refund, after THEY offered it. So I'm stuck with a drain pan that doesn't work...and am out $130.00

ReviewTitle: SLOW BOAT DELIVERY
ReviewText: To get you to order, they say, "fastest delivery in 4 days." Whoot, I order and then see it is coming by slow boat, customs, and two weeks later, if I am lucky, will get the products. Not honest on the delivery time posting. Very, very slow to receive and often past the delivery date they claim. If you have patience for a slow boat, great service.REPLY TO THEIR REPLYI have had many orders with this problem. I contacted you, and you apologized and said it was late for a 5.00 credit. BUT, I need the product, not the money. There was nothing you could do. I did speed up delivery on some that seem to help but still later than you said when I bought for 4 business day delivery.EXAMPLE:"Delivery timeGet shipment updatesFastest arrival within 1 business day. Delivery: Mar 18-25You have upgraded from Standard to Express!"One business day yet weeks off from my order date, this is what you do. You say 1-4 business days but three weeks out once you have the order. HUMMMMYou have them marked as "shipped," but orders are stalled‚ÄîI suspect so you can say, "Too late to cancel and refund when you send back."EXAMPLE OF STALLED LONG ROUTESI tried to get your help, but nothing could. Even when I bought from local, not China. You have a little box to check on if I wouldn't mind it coming from China and taking longer. I have never clicked this box, but you still sent it on a slow boat from China. Here is an example: Being handed over by customsMarch 14, 2025, 2:46 PMPicked up by Truck CarrierMarch 14, 2025, 2:46 PMPicked up by customs clearance companyMarch 10, 2025, 12:51 PMCustoms clearance completedMarch 10, 2025, 2:21 AMCargo terminal deliver to customs clearance companyMarch 10, 2025, 1:27 AMNotify the customs clearance company to pick-upLAXMarch 10, 2025, 12:27 AMPackage arrived at airportMarch 9, 2025, 11:27 PMFlight departureMarch 9, 2025, 3:23 AMAir freight loadingMarch 8, 2025, 8:00 AMPackage arrived at airport, awaiting flightMarch 8, 2025, 7:00 AMPicked up in temu warehouseMarch 7, 2025, 5:00 PMOrder ShippedMarch 4, 2025, 8:09 PMAwaiting ShipmentMarch 4, 2025, 7:24 PMOrder is being packedMarch 4, 2025, 12:18 PMOrder Paid SuccessfullyMarch 3, 2025, 10:44 PMOrder SubmittedMarch 3, 2025, 10:44 PM
