ReviewTitle: Hi my name is Iain Gentles and I have‚Ä¶
ReviewText: Hi my name is Iain Gentles and I have written several reviews regarding Temu.After my last correspondence Temu asked for my details for them to contact me to ascertain from me exactly what has gone wrong with the last order which they send me on February 5 and 6 this year. I gave them the order number, date of order AND the details of exactly the date and time when my First Direct bank account was debited!Yet they have still to contact me by email OR telephone - I passed both of these details to them. The way this organisation operates is to bombard customers with texts and emails promising them goods at knockdown prices and to then ignore reasonable requests to return unwanted goods!I am at my wits end with this company and today have sent back goods totalling ¬£131 but although the package was scanned at my local post office I have very little faith that I will be compensated because they refuse to answer my emails requesting details of my order!Please be very very wary of ordering goods from this organisation üôèThey have never shown me a shred of respect or compassion as a vulnerable pensioner and who does not understand how this company carries out its dubious practices.Iain Gentles

ReviewTitle: I think it's a fair website
ReviewText: I think it's a fair website, need to be careful when purchasing, read everything dimensions features and all reviews. Don't expect to be top quality with the price offered and try not to buy electrical and things you expect to last forever. Return process was alright print label, bagged and sent to post office. Those promotions that they been advertising, extra credit cashback coupon voucher bundle are bound with terms and conditions to promote you to buy more. If you don't need anything then just ignore it. So far have bought a lot of household items and small kitchen gadgets, car and travel assesories and etc they are alright. Some are great and some are a let down so be prepared to return it. !!!Keep your original item bar code to return, cut it out from the packaging for easy storage and return!!!!.

ReviewTitle: The review is about free gifts.
ReviewText: The review is about free gifts. This is the worst experience I've ever had. They offer 3-5 free products for you to win with free shipping. When you're selecting products, they remove the expensive ones from the screen, leaving the cheap ones. But that's not the problem! After selecting products and filling in your shipping address, you'll see that you need 1,000 points to redeem the products. The app starts giving you free points, and your points total reaches 995. A window appears for you to invite friends to get the remaining points. After adding your first friend, you get two points to entice you to invite more. The second gets one point, the third 0.02, the fourth 0.01, and so on. I've invited 10 friends and still need 0.21 points, or 21 more to add to win the gifts. You often lose hope before you can invite everyone because you only have 24 hours to invite them all, and they must be new users. A very bad company.

ReviewTitle: DONT order from temu LOW quality
ReviewText: I recently had a really bad experience ordering from Temu, and I have to say it was one of the worst shopping experiences I've ever had. The quality of the items I got was shockingly poor. I ordered a mix of clothes and home goods, and everything felt like it was made from the cheapest materials. The clothes didn‚Äôt fit well at all and fell apart after just one wash, which is totally unacceptable. The electronics I bought didn‚Äôt even work when I took them out of the box, leaving me feeling frustrated and cheated. To make things worse, the customer service was absolutely useless. I reached out for help with my order, but all I got were generic responses that didn‚Äôt address my specific issues. It felt like I was talking to a wall, and I was left feeling completely ignored. The delivery process was another nightmare. My order was delayed multiple times, and when it finally arrived, several items were missing. The tracking information was misleading, and I had no idea where my package was for days. It was incredibly frustrating to deal with such poor communication. When I finally decided to return some of the items, the refund process was a complete hassle. They claimed they hadn‚Äôt received my returned items, even though I had proof of delivery. It felt like they were trying to cheat me out of my money, and I felt powerless. Overall, my experience with Temu was a disaster. I strongly advise anyone thinking about shopping with them to reconsider. Save your money and shop somewhere else because this company clearly doesn‚Äôt care about its customers. I will never order from Temu again, and I hope others take this warning seriously.

ReviewTitle: Nice products, Bad Company, Bad Customer Service, Shambolic Delivery Service
ReviewText: Temu is not genuine about caring about, or empowering customers to live their best lives like they claim, they regularly fail to deliver orders on time, if you contact Temu they stall you with AI, then robotic sounding humans who aim to sound AI and stick to scripted dialogue that doesn't address your issue. Temu informed me only after my purchase that my order will take up to eight weeks! I don't ever purchase online items that take 56 days to arrive, but letting me know after I ordered didn't give me the option to not proceed or any choice, and is deception. Temu does this because they then can then put the responsibility and inconvenience on the customer to return the order which isn't smooth and they know it. I want my money back, Temu refuse to cancel my order or refund it! They are a money grabbing company that do their best to sound professional but do not operate fully within the law. I should be able to cancel the order that I have not as yet received easily and get my original payment returned as I am not satisfied with Temu's outrageously slow delivery, although I'm their 'valued customer' Ive instead had to dispute Temu with the bank to get my money returned, and I strongly encourage anyone else who is unhappy with Temu's shoddy service to do the same. Temu's real aim is to grab your money no matter what, then lie about your being a 'Dear Valued Customer'. I want a refund for non delivery of my order Temu! I didn't agree to wait 56 days for it! You misled and misinformed me about the ETA. You won't be keeping my money I haven't gifted it to you!Temu's reply below is exactly the kind of condescending nonsense that I've experienced, I've stated I contacted them so why don't they use their systems to know the purchase number ir do they get too many complaints about slow delivery to know, as fir logistics, they don't seem shocked my order will take two months! How dare they keep my money, and for NO DELIVERY, anyway, the bank will reinstate, AGAIN, for anyone experiencing hassle and polite b/s from Temu Customer Services go through your bank to get your refund, Temu is trying to operate within a grey area of the law! TEMU ARE SCAM MERCHANTS POSING AS LEGITIMATE but are a THIRD rate unprofessional service (with a smile of course)Again, Temu emailed me a ridiculous generic message like the numerous ones they use to reply to all these complaints, here's my reply :-What is this message about, precisely what makes Temu incapable of understanding what other consumer companies are able to easily understand? Advising me to keep track of what my bank is doing is not your responsibility Temu, getting my package to me within yoir guaranteed delivery tineframe of within 14 days is your responsibility however you want to put the responsibility everywhere else, on the customer, on the provider, on the weather but not on your shoddy handling of people's orders, you've not persued that at all, but instead give empty and unasked for advice as if to belive it counts as concern for the customer, good customer care, or as doing something. You didn't initiate or want to refund me for breaking your own terms, or for non delivery within a reasonable timeframe, I've had to initiate legal means to compel Temu to do so, your scam needs to be fully investigated and exposed, Temu makes a profit from alot of customer money through items not being delivered to correct destinations, faulty or that never show up and customers not having the time, energy or evn means to go through the hassle of returns. ReviewTitle: My friend tipped me off to this site‚Ä¶
ReviewText: My friend tipped me off to this site about 18 months ago. Basically I have been buying clothes and kitchen/home items. I have never had a problem. Never had to return anything. If I wasn't satisfied with the article it was generally because I didn't pay attention to the measurements. If you go online to Amazon and others you will find exactly the same articles made by the same Chinese companies only 75% more than you can get it for Temu. Two things I really like about Temu. First is their clothes. You choose carefully and you can get some really nice clothes. Some can be cheap but others are well made with good quality cloth. The other thing I really like is that the colours and patterns are so much better than US stuff. That all seems like greys, blacks and other dark and ugly colours/patterns. Temu has beautiful rich colours and really pretty patterns. The second thing I like is that the items like kitchen stuff is really innovative. Just great little gadgets and things I have never seen anywhere. Easy peelers, sharp knives, handy stuff you never see in North America. I would recommend it. I always get my products before the time that is scheduled to be delivered so no problems there.

ReviewTitle: All Hype, No Honesty
ReviewText: I was excited to try Temu, but the experience turned sour quickly. First off, they slap you with a minimum order requirement of LKR 2,218.00 just to check out ‚Äî and this is for first-time users. Most shopping apps don‚Äôt pull these kinds of stunts. It feels more like being pressured into overspending than actually getting a deal.Then there are the ‚Äúfree gifts‚Äù they shout about in ads. I selected the gifts, followed the steps, but at checkout the prices weren‚Äôt zero ‚Äî they showed actual dollar amounts. No explanation, no clarity ‚Äî just misleading marketing.And the spin wheel? I landed on 100% off ‚Äî sounds great, right? Except you can‚Äôt claim it unless you invite people to ‚Äúpack it‚Äù first. It‚Äôs a referral scam disguised as a reward. Pure manipulation.Temu bombards you with flashy offers and fake incentives, but behind the scenes it‚Äôs all hoops, gimmicks, and disappointment. It‚Äôs more frustrating than fun.Until they stop with the tricks and treat customers with transparency, I won‚Äôt be recommending Temu to anyone. Plenty of better, more honest shopping apps out there.
ReplyText: Hello, thank you for your valuable feedback. To support our commitment to sustainability, we encourage customers to meet a minimum order value so that we can more efficiently utilize the available packing space from bags, to our shipping boxes, and containers. By fully allocating the available packing spaces, we reduce the number of boxes used and number of trips made for our deliveries, which helps to reduce carbon emissions to the environment. However, we understand your concern about the policy and will share your feedback to our team for further review. Thank you for helping us understand and serve our customers better. Best wishes, Temu Team

ReviewTitle: A very happy customer!
ReviewText: A very happy customer!I have ordered literally dozens of items from Temu now.If some things are unsuitable I return immediately with no problem whatsoever.If the item was only worth $10 approximately. I was given a refund and told to keep the item anyway.In all honesty I have never asked for a refund back to my credit card because I‚Äôm quite happy to have the amount refunded to Temu as I know there will be a few more bits and pieces I need in the future.If the things I wanted to return were over $10 or more, I was able to take them to the Post office and return for free with no problem.With just about every product I order, I first check the price locally and for the most Timu is much much cheaper.I do get sick of their every day emails promising me all sorts of credits and I just delete them.I order and buy what I want if that sits in my basket for any length of time Temu often offers me one of the articles for free which I happily accept.So far, I have been very happy with my experience with this company and I‚Äôve had no problems whatsoever.
